Paul was a gracious and considerate host, greeting us on arrival with a warm welcome and snacks. We always felt comfortable and free to hang out, make meals, and talk. Hands down one of the best airBnBs I’ve ever had the pleasure to stay in. It’s a NYC gem!

This is my first time as an AirBnB guest (I hosted for over a year when AirBnB had just started and had good experiences as a host). Paul, my host, hit it out of the park. The location is outstanding. Such a lovely upper west side block, across the street and around the corner from Columbia. I was visiting my son who is a student there. Even if Columbia wasn't your destination, Paul's apartment is one block from lovely Riverside Park and the Hudson River. Morningside park is a few blocks to the east. Central Park North and Cathedral Parkway are 5-10 minutes away. The 1 train stops 2-4 blocks away. The UWS is very gracious. The pace is less frenetic which is a nice thing at the end of a day of NYC touring. Yet the nearness of Columbia gives the neighborhood a youthful hip vibe. And Columbia's campus is outstanding; lovely and compact. I felt safe coming and going from Paul's building. The building was well maintained. The hallway outside his door wasn't dark and depressing. There is a laundry in the basement and a garbage chute in the hall on his floor. Paul's apartment is decorated with an artist's eye; the furniture, art, even the plates and skillets, were beautiful, colorful, special. The kitchen/sitting room was filled with light! Everything was in its place. My bedroom had a very big, comfortable bed. The bed linens were soft; the colors were muted and restful. There was plenty of drawer and closet space. The table lighting was exceptional. I had a lovely view of a church and Columbia outside my bedroom window. Paul was so kind to welcome me very early due to my 5a arrival into JFK on a red eye from SF. He was quickly responsive when I requested my stay. He met me and welcomed me into his home. He made me tea, fruit and nuts. He gave me plenty of towels and wash clothes. He gave me a shelf in the bathroom for my toiletries. I unpacked, showered (plenty of hot water), and headed out to my first meeting. Paul was lovely to talk to, yet respectful of my privacy. He welcomed both of my young adult children into his home. My daughter (who is graduating from NYU) cooked 2 breakfasts in Paul's kitchen. She so enjoyed his window seat in his kitchen. My son lingered and did schoolwork at the kitchen table. Paul's space was so much more gracious than a dorm room! Paul even printed out my boarding pass when I was out and about. He also printed 36 pages of work that I had completed while spending the day in the libraries at Columbia and the cafes near Columbia while my son wrote a paper. Making that personal connection with Paul enhanced my stay. But he was so quiet and gracious that guests who want to keep to themselves would also be comfortable. My son has 3 more years at Columbia and...

Extremely clean, quiet and close to Barnard and Columbia campuses, transportation and places to eat.  Paul was generous with his time and his space while allowing us great privacy.   We would return without pause.

Paul's apartment is a corner apartment in one of the typical New York buildings around Colombia university. The location could not be better. You are at the doorstep of Colombia as well as on a short walking distance to St John the Divine and Central Park. The 1-line (subway) is literally around the corner so Midtown is very easy to reach. The apt is quiet and I slept really well. Paul knows the area very well and was very generous not only sharing his apt but also his inside tips & tricks about the area. Paul is a genuine person who does whatever he can to make your stay as comfortable as possible.
Paul was a fantastic host. We're grateful for his help and for allowing us to use his wonderful apartment.

Great place, exactly what I needed. 

Paul was a great host and will for sure be returning when needed. He gave me my space as needed but was always there when and if I needed him for anything.

Feel like I made a friend in NYC :) Thanks again Paul!!

Paul's place is a great place to stay. Paul was very helpful with finding out what was happening in the city, suggestions for where to go, getting to know and navigate the area, and was fun to talk with about the history and character of the neighborhood and NY. He was great about check-in and out.  He is very thoughtful and accommodating and I would definitely stay here again!

As a visiting student at Columbia University, my 3-month stay was really pleasant and comfortable. Paul is always considerate while giving me enough privacy. The apartment has everything I need, including all the facilities and a cozy bedroom, so it just feel like home. 

Columbia main campus is just cross the street. Subway is 5min walk. Plenty of food and grocery stores around. 5min walk from riverside park.

Paul's communication at every stage of the process was fabulous from our initial inquiry to our arrival time.  He met us outside his apartment, got us settled in, answered endless questions about places to eat and get coffee, and how to manage the subway and trains for our various expeditions.   He was unfailingly in good cheer.  And I would absolutely stay with him again.

Paul es un super host, es atento, amable, su departamento es hermoso, limpio, ordenado y muy muy cómodo. Esta a unos pasos del metro que corre por el centro, es fácil llegar a todos lados.

Muy muy recomendable!!!

Loved our stay! Paul is warm, responsive, full of local tips, and genuinely happy to have us guests around. And yet unobtrusive — never had to compete for the bathroom (I was worried about the shared bath beforehand), and I always felt like we had complete privacy when we needed it.

Location cannot be beat; just two minutes to Barnard and Columbia and the subway.  Easy to hop on subway to get to Broadway shows too.

Parking was free and fairly easy, and I was always able to park within a block or two. I only had to move my car once to avoid street cleaning.

On 8th floor so quiet and bed is a comfy; we slept like babies.  

We enjoyed Paul and his home so much we feel like we have a family member in the city and plan to be back!
Paul is a friendly, thoughtful and responsive host. The apartment is well kept. The location of the building is very convenient.
The host canceled this reservation 32 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This place exceeded all of my expectations. Paul made me feel right at home -- arranged keys at times good for me, helped move my stuff, made the kitchen free and available, and overall provided a warm, comfortable environment.  Highly recommended.
Great place to stay! And so close to campus!
Paul is friendly and considerate. His place is very close to the Columbia Univerisity. I was overall satisfied, but one minor issue was that the heater sometimes  made some noise that woke me up.
Great location, clean, good hospitality.

Paul is a great host! He never hesitates to spend his personal time to ensure your stay at his apartment is comfortable and great. He made me feel at home and he is extremely polite. The apartment is located in a great location and is best suited for anyone who is there for any work at Columbia University. I highly recommend Paul's apartment!

name: Apartamento para as olimpíadas
summary: Indevassável, localizado entre Laranjeiras, Aterro do Flamengo e Praia de Botafogo.  Prédio com portaria 24 h na rua do Palácio Guanabara. Próximo a praça São Salvador, que tem movimentação toda noite. A localização permite agradáveis passeios a pé.

name: Artist Garden Duplex Ft. Greene - 2.5 Bedroom
summary: Beautifully renovated Brownstone garden duplex - BEST BLOCK in Ft. Greene (S Portland Ave). High end renovation: full kitchen, private entrance, master bedroom with Queen bed, glass partition, study (extra bed - the "half bedroom"), glass doors to patio/garden. Living room sofa opens to Queen. Cellar: TV room, extra sleep quarters (3 twins or  king), bath w shower . Perfect for 1 - 2 couples or families.  5 minutes to BAM, subways, restaurants, park, farmer's market. Superb base for NY vacation.
space: Gorgeous brownstone garden duplex (private entrance) on best block - sleeps 8. Main floor comfortably sleeps 4: 1 queen in master bedroom, queen sleeper sofa in living room with luxurious high end kitchen and bathroom.  Cellar TV room has two regular twins that fit together to make a king bed (I add a foam strip to fill the gap between the two twins and belt the two mattresses together so they don't come apart when made into a king) and two extra long twin futons that sit on the floor;  full bathroom with tub and shower. Note: This is not a conventional 3 bedroom! Some guests prefer placing a futon in the extension and using it as another bedroom. This can work great with kids. The entrance to the bathroom is through the master bedroom so from the extension, you walk through the master bedroom to get to the kitchen or bathroom. Full backyard garden (gorgeous woodland feel - cool and shaded in summer) with BBQ and private patio.  Please read "Other things to note" below! The house is be
description: Beautifully renovated Brownstone garden duplex - BEST BLOCK in Ft. Greene (S Portland Ave). High end renovation: full kitchen, private entrance, master bedroom with Queen bed, glass partition, study (extra bed - the "half bedroom"), glass doors to patio/garden. Living room sofa opens to Queen. Cellar: TV room, extra sleep quarters (3 twins or  king), bath w shower . Perfect for 1 - 2 couples or families.  5 minutes to BAM, subways, restaurants, park, farmer's market. Superb base for NY vacation. Gorgeous brownstone garden duplex (private entrance) on best block - sleeps 8. Main floor comfortably sleeps 4: 1 queen in master bedroom, queen sleeper sofa in living room with luxurious high end kitchen and bathroom.  Cellar TV room has two regular twins that fit together to make a king bed (I add a foam strip to fill the gap between the two twins and belt the two mattresses together so they don't come apart when made into a king) and two extra long twin futons that sit on the floor;  full ba
neighborhood_overview: Ft Greene is a fabulous neighborhood, accessible to everything. People love living in this part of NYC. My house is on what is considered the "the best block," most central with elegant brownstones, Sycamores. Within just a couple blocks is the neighborhood park with playground , farmer's market, flea market, Brooklyn Academy of Music (dance, theater, movies, concerts), restaurants and cafes. Check out from NY Times real estate section - a promo piece: (URL HIDDEN)
notes: We provide all linens (high quality) you require and we'll make up the master bed and the twins in the cellar but leave the other beds for you to make up (in case you want to set up the sofa as a bed each night). Linens for the sofa queen, twins and king including mattress pads are located in the plastic storage cases under the cellar stairs. Extra towels and pillows can be found in the closets in the master bedroom and the bathroom vanity in the cellar. When you leave, please clean your dishes and put them away. Thank you!
transit: You will not find a better location to stay in Brooklyn.  You can easily go anywhere by subway within minutes of the house. Time to the Financial District: 15 - 20 minutes; to Penn Station and Time Square: 30 minutes; Upper East or Upper West Side: 40 minutes. The house is 1 1/2 blocks to the C and G, 5 minutes to both the Atlantic Avenue (2, 3, 4, 5, N, R, Q, D) and DeKalb (B, Q, N, R) subway stations and the LIRR.
access: The duplex is for your use alone, with a private entrance under the stoop.  If you have a late afternoon or evening flight, you can stay in the apartment until you need to leave if no one has booked it. Otherwise, you can leave your luggage upstairs with me and collect it when its time to go to the airport. Just ask and we'll arrange! KEY: The key to the apartment is a medico key. Because so many guests have left without returning a key to me, I now have to charge $10 to replace it so please take care not to loose it. I typically provide two keys.
interaction: I'm happy to help either before you arrive or once you are here! I live upstairs and own the Brownstone.
house_rules: The house can't accept pets and no smoking except outside. No extra guests.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States

reviews.comments: Beautiful place, would definitely come back!

Great apartment, great location! The flat is newly remodeled and everything is brand new and clean. It is very spacious- perfect for our group of 2 adults, 2 small children. The location is a very safe neighborhood, beautiful block and very near restaurants, parks. Miriam was readily available and her list of restaurants, shops was helpful. The check in/out was seamless. We will definitely stay there again- hopefully for longer.
Our family of 4 enjoyed staying at Miriam's. Very close to subway or trains, it is a nice and calm location if you wants to visit NYC (20 mins from Wall St) and Brooklyn wich is a very nice aera.

Miriam was excellent. It was my first time using airbnb and it was for work colleagues of mine.  I can only go by what my colleagues said and it was  absolutely awesome. They were able to cook dinner and save us money instead of having them eat out everynight. They loved the space and wanted to stay longer.  It was nice and convienent to our marina on pier 5!

I used to live in the neighborhood and can attest Miriam's place is on a top notch street in an amazing location! She did a great job furnishing the apartment and making the place comfortable for a family stay. Miriam was also very accommodating and didn't hesitate to turn up the heat for our unseasonably cold visit. We'd love to stay here again on our next Brooklyn visit!

Miriam ha estat una bona amfitriona. La comunicació sempre ha estat immediata i positiva. Ha estat molt respectuosa amb la nostra intimitat i ens ha obsequiat amb diferents detalls.
L'apartament ocupa la part baixa d'una típica casa "Brownstone". Disposa d'un jardinet al darrer ideal per les èpoques de temperatura suau.
La ubicació és immillorable. Hi ha moltes línies de metro a tocar de l'apartament. En 20-25 minuts s'arriba a Manhattan. Està ubicat a un barri de Brooklyn molt ben situat. L'ambient és molt bo i està ple d'opcions al voltant.
Cal tenir en compte que disposa d'una habitació doble per allotjar a dues persones i que la resta s'hauran d'acomodar en un sofà llit i en uns futons a terra en el soterrani de l'habitatge. En el soterrani, sense finestres, s'ubica la sala de màquines, canonades, un traster i un petit bany.
A la penúltima nit hi va haver una inesperada fuita d'aigua al soterrani que Miriam i la seva família van resoldre molt ràpidament.

Hem estat 12 dies a l'apartament i, en general, ha estat molt positiu.

We had a wonderful stay at Miriam's apartment in Ft. Greene.  She made us feel perfectly welcomed from the beginning and throughout our stay.  The apartment was perfect for our family of 4 as it was clean, comfortable, and spacious. Miriam was also very flexible in allowing us to have a small celebration for my 40th birthday with friends and family at the apartment.  The apartment proved to be perfect for our gathering because of its amazing location (especially with its proximity to the park, playgrounds, and other local businesses) and its spaciousness and comfort.  We would happily stay at Miriam's apartment on future trips to Brooklyn and strongly recommend it to others.  Thank you Miriam!

Míriam is a marvelous host. 
Also her apartment is amazing! We rented there for 10 days. 
Everything is exactly what she described, and more. 
If you want to experience the Brooklyn life style, here you will have it!  Beautiful markets, facilities, subway, neighborhood.

We made this apartment our Christmas Central gathering spot. The kitchen is very well equipped for cooking as well as serving-dishes and glassware enough for our crowd. The little things were appreciated-enough hangers in the coat closet to stow our coats, dishwashing detergent under the sink, so we didn't have to buy that at the market. Really nice linens on the beds, plenty of towels, good lighting. Amazing main bathroom shower-we took pictures of it! 
Great closet space, again with coat hangers. Off of the main bedroom, there is an away space-office type room. My husband used it to meditate, but it'd be great for any kind of quiet space. We didn't use the courtyard, but it would be so nice to utilize in milder weather. 
We didn't see Miriam, but she was very good at communicating by email.
Great host and excellent communication.
Very modern, clean, comfortable. Bathroom drain did not work and Miriam addressed it immediately on a Saturday.

We had a great stay at Miriam's place. It was a great location, lots of fab restaurants close by & easy to get on the subway!
Miriam was a great host answering any questions. We would definitely recommend this apartment & hope to visit again!!!!
Plenty of room for my family. My 17 year old son loved the lower level space.  Great access to transportation and local restaurants.
Great location, family friendly had a wonderful time staying at Miriam's home
Beautiful home and very close to restaurants and night life activities, however there isn't much street parking!
The place was very warm and welcoming.  Miriam was very responsive and a great host.  We would stay there again with no hesitation.

This property exceeded our expectations.  We have spent a lot of time in New York City in the past and I was amazed at how quiet this place was.  It's on a lovely street in a very beautiful and safe area.  We traveled to Manhattan every day and the subways were close and convenient.  The property was so much more spacious than I expected and was perfect for our family of 4 .  There is close access to restaurants and markets.  We were impressed and would definitely stay again.  My only disappointment is that it wasn't the right time of year to enjoy the beautiful courtyard in the back.
très agréable logement très bon accueil de Myriam
Such a great place!  Fantastic location with comfortable beds and enough space for two couples to have their own areas.

The stay at Miriams home was very umcomplecated and friendly. The apartment was very clean and well-appointed. We loved cooking in the commodious kitchen or going to one of the restaurants recommended by Miriam (ecspecially the mexican one not far away from the house) .

El apartamento es muy cómodo y super equipado con todo lo necesario, recomendable, la única queja es que el wi-fi no andaba muy bien, pero el resto es un 10. el barrio es muy lindo y con buen acceso a todos lados con el metro. muy recomendable, buena experiencia, las camas son la gloria.

We have been staying at Miriam's for a full week (6 people). Communication with her is outstanding, she was very helpful with tips how to get to her place (Subway). Good location, subway within 5 mins (C - Lafayette Av, G - Fulton St) and 10 mins (B, Q, R - DeKalb Av) which is giving you lots of options to go to Manhattan. Many good Restaurants and Bars within 15mins by foot - nice and calm neighbourhood. 

The flat is clean and well equiped. When using the sleeper-sofa in the livingroom as a bed (as we did with 6 people), there is no direct access to the bathroom; one has to go through the bedroom. Garden can be used for BBQ and dining after a long day in the city - just great.

Would come back anytime!
Miriam delivered what she promised. Great communicator. Family enjoyed their stay

Asunto oli todella siisti, tilava ja hyvin varusteltu. Sijainti on täydellinen NY lomalle. Alakerrassa nukkuminen vaatii hyvät unenlahjat, koska ilmastointilaitteen kosteudeneroitin pitää aika kovaa meteliä. Asunnossa on kuitenkin todella hyvin tilaa ja nukkumapaikkoja 5-6 henkilölle vaikka alakerrassa ei kukaan nukkuisikaan. Myös Wi-Fi katkeili jatkuvasti, mutta olen tyytyväinen, että oli edes jonkinmoinen nettiyhteys. Miriamin yhteydenpito oli asiallista ja hyvää. Ohjeet avainten saamiseen tuli hyvissä ajoin ja olivat selkeät. Myös asunnossa oli selkeät ohjeet kaikkeen tarvittavaan. Kaiken kaikkiaan olemme erittäin tyytyväisiä tähän asuntoon ja majoittajaan. Suosittelen erittäin lämpimästi, 5 tähteä.

Miriam's home was the perfect location for our family's summer trip to Brooklyn.  Her home was well appointed with all the basic necessities one would need for cooking and relaxing when you needed a break from the city.  The apartment is on the most picturesque street of stunning brownstones and lovely old trees.  It it quiet and felt very safe and is conveniently located near many restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores and namely, the lovely Fort Greene park which we visited almost daily with our four young children.  Close to many subway lines, Miriam's apartment was perfectly located for popping into Manhattan as well as getting around Brooklyn in general.  
Check in was seamless, Miriam was the perfect balance of attentive and easy to get in touch with without feeling like you were being "watched".  The apartment was very clean and had everything we needed and was very comfortable.  We met many neighbors and my children played with some of the neighborhood children on several occasions and have even made a pen pal.  
Thank you so much, we would love to stay there again in future travels.

Vi var familie med 2 bedsteforældre, 2 forældre og 2 børnebørn.
Vi havde en fantastisk ferie. Skønt at opholde sig de dette lokalområde med venlige naboer og dejligt at komme hjem til roen efter hektiske Manhattan.

Superbe appartement en sous sol dans un quartier très sympa de Brooklyn, vous rejoindrez facilement tout les supers restaurants de brooklyn et le metro Jay street ou Delkab pour allé facilement à Manhattan, de plus l appartement est à deux pas de  Delkab market qu il faut absolument faire lors de votre visite à brooklyn, l appartement est superbe et 
vraiment grand. Pour une famille de 4 ou 5 personnes c'est l'endroit parfait.

This is such a could place to stay if you want to explore New York and particularly Brooklyn. Me and my family (me and my husband, two teenagers and a younger one) stayed there for a little bit more then 2 weeks and we just loved ut. The picture of the apartment really tell you the truth. It´s clean, wifi works well, the garden with the possibility for a BBQ is like a small rainforest in the middle av the city. Miriam is a really good host and easy to get in contact with if needed - for both questions and travel- och restaurant recommendations. Many different stations for metro in the surrounding makes travel easy and Fort Greene as a neighborhood is great and a good hub for exploring Williamsburg, Brooklyn Heights, Red Hook and other interesting parts of Brooklyn. Why don´t take a evening walk to Brooklyn bridge park or an a morning jog in Fort Green park just outside the door? We would absolutely consider to stay here again when we do our next trip to NYC.
Wir hatten eine schöne Zeit in New York. Die Wohnung liegt in einer guten Lage, die U-Bahn war nur 3 Minuten entfernt. Alles war sauber und schön.

L'appartement de Myriam regroupe toutes les qualités attendus et/ou imaginés :
- proche de 3 stations de métro
- proche commerces de proximité, restaurants ...
- rue calme
- architecture typique de la maison : "brownstone" comme dans les films
- confort irréprochable de l'appartement, équipement de haute qualité, tout est neuf ! :)
- assistance de Myriam qui est pleine de bonnes intentions.
Au final, nous avons passés 10 jours magnifiques à Brooklyn et Manhattan. Cet appartement a contribué à la réussite de ce séjour, c'et sûr ! Merci.

My wife, I and 2 teenage daughters stayed 5 nights at Miriams place and we couldnt have been happier with our choice. The apartment is ideally located for quick access into Manhattan via 3 different lines. We saw the location as far enough out but close enough in. The area is safe and quiet. The apartment is nicely furnished with a large kitchen and even has an outdoor garden at the back. The only negative aspects I would highlight is that the air conditioning is controlled from the apartment above and that the Wifi had a very limited range throughout the apartment.
Other than those 2 minor and easily fixed problems this was a lovely apartment and would happily stay there again.

Beautiful location and very convenient for restaurants, good food shops, even a bookshop, as well as subway to Manhattan.  The apartment is spacious, attractive and we had a great time.  Every question we had was answered very quickly.   I'd certainly recommend.

Miriam was a wonderful host, everything was ready and waiting for us, we had everything we could need. This apartment is in a wonderful neighborhood with great shopping and restaurants and convenient to the Metro. Great place to stay if your planning to visit NYC. We would definitely rent this place again.
Très bon emplacement, maison propre conforme aux photos et à nos attentes, tous le necessaire est disponible. Miriam est une hôte disponible et agréable.
Everything is great. The whole house is very clean and comfortable. It is also near the subway station which is very convenient for us to get to the Manhattan. Strong recommendation :)
Great place for 6 of us plus a baby! Got a little warm sometimes, but the outdoor area was awesome and perfect for our needs. :)

Miriam was a great host, her home was delightful! Great place to stay with a family, close to everything you need in Brooklyn and in a great area and also close to public transport to get into Manhattan.

Miriam was a great host. She was Quico to reply, and really helpful. The neighborhood is fun, full of cool places to go out to. Different metro lines are also easy to reach. We went with our 11 month old and family, and plenty of nice parks were close by.  I would recommend the place to anyone!!
This garden apartment was perfect for a girls getaway. There was plenty of space and it was the perfect location. We will definitely try to return in the future.  Miriam was the Perfect host!!

We had a wonderful time in this gorgeous apartment and Miriam was a fantastic host. We know the neighborhood well, and this is a much nicer and better-remodeled unit than most of them in the area. The area itself is our favorite, close to the park and the farmer's market and lots of subway lines. The restaurants and ease of life there are all great. We loved this stay and it was great for my daughter (8yo) and I'm sure would be great for 2-3 kids and a family.
Enjoyed our stay. Many food/bar options within walking distance. Near by Park/subway and Miriam accommodated my early arrival and late stay. Thank you.

Nice apartment, friendly host, nice and quiet neighborhood. We where 6 people - three generations together. We enjoyed local cafes and restaurants in the evenings. Very close to subway and connections to JFK.
L'appartement est fonctionnel , agréable dans un quartier calme et typique facilement accessible depuis Manhattan. Notre séjour avec 4 adolescents a été très réussi.

Miriam est vraiment très accueillante et trés attentionnée. son appartement est parfait pour visiter toute la ville, très bien situé, proche de trois lignes de métro. Dans un quartier vraiment agréable avec tous les commerces  en proximité. 
L'appartement est confortable, très bien équipé. Nous avons passé un merveilleux séjour.
Miriam is really very welcoming and very attentive. his apartment is perfect for visiting the whole city, very well located, close to three subway lines. In a really nice area with all the shops nearby.
The apartment is comfortable, very well equipped. We had a wonderful stay.

We were a family of 5 - (4) adults and (1) 3-yr old, visiting for the NYC Marathon.  The location of the apartment could not have been better.  It is located at mile 8 of the course.  Just about a 500 foot walk!  The apartment is located very close to subway into Manhattan and surrounding areas.  Plenty of good restaurants and convenience stores nearby.  Our favorite was the Green Grape & Provisions, for wine, craft beer and fresh soups, etc.  Miriam was so helpful in giving us her "spot" on the street for one car and we were very lucky to find a 2nd spot on the street for our 2nd car.  There are rules around times you can park, but we arrived on Friday afternoon and stayed until Tuesday with no problems at all. There are garages in the surrounding area that do have spots available for longer stays if needed. The apartment itself is clean and comfortable, although we did not spend much time there.  The master with bathroom was nice, and the 2nd bedroom in the basement was fine, but be sure to understand it is the basement with furnace in the room and slightly steep stairs.  Great towels and linens were also provided.  Miriam was a very good host!
Wonderful place very comfortable. Great location. Had a small issue with one of the showers.  Miriam immediately replied and called for a repair.  We will definitely return
We loved our stay at Miriam’s place and the space worked perfectly for our Family of four with two young kids.

The place was marvelous! It had that vintage look from de 1900's. The rooms were big and looked recently renovated. The bathrooms were spacious. The kitchen helped us a lot, but we missed having a blender. The neighborhood was great, near subways, restaurants and cafes. I would certainly stay there again! Ideal for families 4+.
Excellent location on a classic Brooklyn street. Close to public transport. House was perfect for us - 2 adults and 2 teenage boys. Miriam communicated promptly when we required any assistance.

I want to thank Miriam for being such a great host and responding immediately to anything that we needed. She was also very helpful with some great suggestions on local restaurants. The location was convenient to all Subway train locations and we look forward to returning to the Artist Garden Duplex one day.

Location was excellent with easy access to subways. Local restaurants were also great. The apartment was clean and well equipped and even in the bitterly cold weather we were very warm. We had plenty of space for 2 adults and 3 teenage children.

Absolutely amazing place and host !
Clean, good spot (close to Subway), responding immediately, well prepared with maps with shopping locations around and actually all you need for enjoying for holidays.
A pleasant Airbnb experience!
Het huis is in een rustige straat gelegen, perfect om tot rust te komen na Sightseeing in Manhattan. In de omgeving zijn genoeg winkels en restaurants. We hadden een aangenaam verblijf.
Miriam’s place is lovely and is in a fantastic location. She was very available and helpful. I highly recommend the apt, which was extremely comfortable and well equipped.

We spent 2 great weeks in Miriam's flat. It is very well located, close to several subway lines (easy to go everywhere), shops and restaurants. The place is really quiet. The flat is well decorated and fully equiped. Quality Linen and bedding. Miriam was always available and reactive to give us all the information we needed. We strongly recommend Miriam's flat.
Een heerlijk huis van alle gemakken voorzien, in een supergezellige en relaxte buurt. Je bent overal zo met de metro.

The Apartment is full of character, while having all modern facilities. We loved the building itself, the street and the locality. A super part of Brooklyn. Mister Mango and local restaurants are definite plus factors

We stayed in this apartment for 7 amazing nights and I cannot emphasize enough how great this apartment is.  It is within short walking distance of all the awesome things Brooklyn has to offer, to include all the new things along Fulton, and the new Dekalb food court across from LIU Brooklyn.  Miriam was the best host we have ever had while staying in an airbnb or (Hidden by Airbnb) ,  She checked on us shortly after our arrival, and was always incredibly responsive to any need we had.  I would HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this apartment!
Great stay in Brooklyn.  Miriam was very responsive and the apartment was  fantastic.
Brilliant place and host. location is brilliant. It's a really vibrant and cosmopolitan area with plenty of cool local bars and restaurants.
Miriam was a lovely and attentive host. The house itself was perfect for a family of four and very well located in an ideal part of Brooklyn. We would certainly stay again

The place was ideal and an amazing find in the heart of Fort Greene. A great place for our family - less than a block from the park (and two blocks from the hospital which we had to use after a fall at said park) and a great home base, which was important as we have a 14mo old. Miriam was so kind and sweet and very patience with us (we needed to check in a little early and leave a little late and she totally accommodated us). So grateful for this experience and will be staying there again!
Nice place in a great neighborhood that can fit a family easily

Our family of four with teens had a pleasant and comfortable 6 night stay at Miriam's. The apartment stayed cool despite the heat and humidity outside and it was great to come back after a day of exploring. The area is safe and convenient with plenty of options for getting into the city. The description is accurate. The apartment is atypical and the TV area is part of the cellar. Our kids slept well down there. It was great to have two bathrooms and a washer and dryer.
Miriam was a great host, responding quickly to questions or needs and making sure we were doing okay, but respected our privacy. I would definitely stay there again if I went back to New York.

A lovely, stylish apartment in a vibrant and beautiful location.  Loads of space, comfortable and great place to come home to after a day in the city. Miriam was great as a host, always available, friendly and helpful.   Highly recommended.

Ideally located for visiting New York City, fully furnished in a nice and green neighborhood.
Great atmosphere, local shops and restaurants
Une maison typiquement dans l’esprit de Brooklyn, ravissante très bien située, très bien équipée très propre, proche de stations de métro très pratiques. Belle découverte.

Miriam's apartment is extremely comfortable and well-equiped, will all amenities. And we also discovered that it was perfectly located:the neighborhood is charming and lively, with several metro lines just around the corner, but it is also less tiring than Manhattan. It was great to go back to Miriam's place after a long and busy day of visits. Thank you so much, Miriam, we really enjoyed our stay.

Très bon séjour, appartement très confortable, silencieux, pratique, très bien équippé. Lits faits à l'arrivée, tout le necessaire est déjà présent y compris les basiques pour la nourriture. Il ne manque rien. Climatisation dans la chambre parent très appréciée. Très propre, bien situé pour accéder à tout NY. Séjour avec des enfants supers. Arrivée / départ très simple. Hôte très flexible, réactif.
Appartement confortable (juste un peu sombre mais vu l'été caniculaire...) très bien situé, séjour très agréable. Merci Miriam!
Great place to stay! Beautiful neighborhood with a lot of neat restaurants nearby! Miriam is a great host and made sure all our needs were met!

Miriam is a very nice and attentive host. The place is exactly as she has described it and can house quite a few people if needed. We were only 3 women so each of us had her own space. We also liked the kitchen for having breakfast in the morning and not having to run out all the time. The neighborhood is really nice, you can buy good quality groceries nearby. Several subway stations are also nearby so you have options going into Manhattan depending on where you want to go. Unfortunately, it gets a bit loud in the basement when it is very hot and the aircon is running over night. Overall, a very positive experience :-)

Nous avons passés un très bon séjour chez Miriam avec qui la communication a été excellente. L'appartement est bien agencé, l'équipement est moderne et les lits confortables. Il est situé dans un très bon quartier de Brooklyn près de plusieurs stations de métros et de plusieurs restaurants.
Dans l'ensemble très bon séjour et surtout hôte qui sait écouter et résoudre les problèmes rencontrés par ses invités.
Merci encore!

Miriam was the perfect host and very helpful when we had questions. The apartment was as described and perfect for our stay. Subway almost outside the door, so we could easily get around quickly. Would definitely stay there again.
Charming and conveniently located apartment. Friendly and attentive host!
Beautiful spot in an amazing location. Quiet, clean and stylish - and right next to everything you need in Fort Greene. We had a great stay here and would definitely come again!

My family and I loved staying at Miriam's place for our NYC trip. It was in a great location of BK close to several subway lines, coffee shops, restaurants and the park. The home itself was comfortable, clean and enough room for the 6 of us. Miriam was an outstanding host - she checked in and provided updates prior to our stay and during our stay she was very responsive and went above and beyond to accommodate us by providing extra keys, supplies and even let us store our luggage after check out until it was time to leave for our flights. I highly recommend staying at Miriam's place!

Miriam was a wonderful host, she made sure we checked in ok and even looked out for us with parking the car, making sure we were in the right spot so we didn't get towed for street cleaning. We managed to park our car for free on the street all weekend which was awesome. The place was beautiful, perfectly clean and cozy with everything you could possibly need. Also it was in a great area, lovely street close to the park and great surrounding areas. We would definitely recommend Miriam's apartment.

We had a very pleasant stay at Miriam’s brownstone. After long walks in Manhattan it was a pleasure going back home, because we really had the feeling of being at Home. We were 7 and we had all the space, 2 bathrooms was a must and a large opened kitchen which was fully equipped to spend good breakfast, lunch or dinner time. We didn’t have the opportunity to relax in the garden but it was charming and we believe that it must be so cool to have BBQ or jus rest. We discovered the neighborhood, just turn the quiet street the home is and you’ll get in Brooklyn, a slice of New York in a more relaxed atmosphere and authentic architecture. Nice restaurants, subways to go anywhere, groceries with fresh foods, it’s all around the corner. Few minutes from the apartment you can go to Barclays center and see NBA Brooklyn Nets, have shopping in Fulton & Jays streets, Fort Greene park  is a nice place, only 4 stations to reach Brooklyn Bridge and its unique view of Manhattan with the C train which is only 3 minutes from the apartment at walking distance,  Thanks to Miriam we had a wonderful stay in New York Brooklyn.
Wonderful neighborhood and quick responses!

Miriam is an amazing superhost! The apartment was very clean and exactly what we expected. She is very responsive when you have a question. I would definitely recommend her apartment. 5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
We found that the space and the host are as great as the description and the reviews said.   Miriam worked to ensure that we were well informed and our stay was enjoyable.

Great spot, great host. I’d highly recommend this apartment, especially in the fall when you can enjoy the leaves in the park down the street or in the summer to enjoy the beautiful patio space. Miriam is quick with her responses and helpful in all ways a host should be.
Great place to stay

Miriam is a gracious host and her apartment is amazing. The location is an easy walk to the park, restaurants, coffee, bookstores, arts, you name it. The apartment's amenities are great and, although it was cooler weather, we loved the little backyard garden. Would definitely stay here again.

Miriam's garden apartment is a lovely place to stay in Brooklyn, close to Fort Greene Park and easily accessible by public transportation.  The apartment is spacious and welcoming, plenty of room for our family of 6 (us, our grown-up kids and one grandchild).  Miriam responded quickly to our questions, and was a gracious host.  We would stay here again, and highly recommend it.
Excellent stay.  Miriam was an amazing host and very accommodating. Nice neighborhood and loved the Brownstone.  Would definitely rebook.

Miriam’s accomodation was great fir our trip. We have 3(almost adult children) and needed separate spaces, with the ability to come together fir meals etc, so the house was perfect. 
The house itself was a lovely homey space with good facilities and lots of home comforts. 
The location had so many options for facilities to eat etc and public transport was also great fir its varying options. 
I would stay again, if we are so lucky to come back to NY
Miriam was excellent to work with. The place was as described, clean and conveniently located

name: Cozy Hell's Kitchen Apt
summary: 1 bedroom Apt in Hell's Kitchen/Midtown West area . Close to Broadway Theaters & Times Sq. Walk to Central Park or West Side Highway . Apt faces the building courtyard which makes it quiet & serine. It's a small apartment adequate for solo, business travelers, or couples. There is no elevator, the apartment is located on the 4th floor ( must climb stairs)The building was built in 1920.
space: Clean, Small 1 bedroom apartment, located on the 4th floor of a 1920’s building. It is close to public transportation, restaurants, bars, and Times Square.
description: 1 bedroom Apt in Hell's Kitchen/Midtown West area . Close to Broadway Theaters & Times Sq. Walk to Central Park or West Side Highway . Apt faces the building courtyard which makes it quiet & serine. It's a small apartment adequate for solo, business travelers, or couples. There is no elevator, the apartment is located on the 4th floor ( must climb stairs)The building was built in 1920. Clean, Small 1 bedroom apartment, located on the 4th floor of a 1920’s building. It is close to public transportation, restaurants, bars, and Times Square. Private bedroom  is yours for the entire stay  as well of use of the Kitchen & Bathroom. *Please note there is a storage room that is not for guest access. It is the room behind the beige curtain* The kitchen is fully stocked with pots, pans and dishes if you like to cook.  I have tons of spices that you are welcome to use as well.  There is a full stove & toaster oven but no microwave. I'm always available by phone for any questions. 2 Avenues away f
neighborhood_overview: 2 Avenues away from subways, 10 min walk to Central Park & Times Sq.  Apt is near lots of restaurants, theaters, & the westside highway. It’s easy to get cabs. There’s also plenty of parking garages in the area.
notes: I have a small cat that lives in the apartment full time (he doesn’t leave) I get a lot of questions regarding this - please read the entire listing carefully. Apartment door self locks, be careful not to lock yourself out. Lost Key is a $250 fee Please don't lose the keys! Friday check in time is after 6pm,  Saturday check in time is flexible.
transit: C & E subway lines  located two avenues away. 1,2, N,Q, & W subway lines are located 3 avenues away. It’s easy to get cabs on any of the avenues.
access: Private bedroom  is yours for the entire stay  as well of use of the Kitchen & Bathroom. *Please note there is a storage room that is not for guest access. It is the room behind the beige curtain* The kitchen is fully stocked with pots, pans and dishes if you like to cook.  I have tons of spices that you are welcome to use as well.  There is a full stove & toaster oven but no microwave.
interaction: I'm always available by phone for any questions.
house_rules: Please do not leave dirty dishes . Lost Key is $250 fee Please don't lose the keys! I’m not responsible for any belongings  left behind. In the event you do leave something behind, it is your responsibility to pay for any mailing /shipping fees incurred to get them back to you.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States

reviews.comments: The apt is wonderfully quiet and serine even though it's in the middle of a vibrant, bustling, hip location since it is located facing an inner courtyard.  The only sounds beside the soft murmur of the city was the occasional wail of a distant siren. The apt is very small but adequate for a couple. There is no elevator.  We loved Tiger, the cat, and he kept to  himself, but some visitors may be allergic to cats. Karen was very solicitous and kind. The bagels were a treat. The restaurant scene, two-blocks away, is world-class, whether expensive or inexpensive, great value: wonderful places to eat, drink and walk. Theater district is right there. We will definitely return...

Karen was a gratuitous host!  We had everything we needed for our weekend in the city!   Room was exactly what we needed to catch the Global Citizens festival in Central Park concerts on Saturday and Eddie Vedder at the Beacon theater on Sunday...  Great places to eat near by!  TV in bedroom had access to Hulu and Netflix, which was great because like to sleep in and watch TV in the mornings... Will repeat again!   Thanks for everything Karen!!!!
Karen was very welcoming. Her apartment is in a quieter part of the city which was nice and only a short walk from all the main action.

Karen was extremely helpful, and her place, though very small and tight, was quite comfy. I just have to remind myself that this is Manhattan and not some sort of 5star hotel, space is limited and everything was developed hundreds years ago, so didn't expect anything out of ordinary NY living.  Karen is a GREAT host! She made sure me and my wife had everything we needed and practicality had the entire place to ourselves.  Thank you for allowing us to crash at ur place Karen! :)
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The location is great, walking distance to Time Square, the bed is cozy. Karen was helpful and kind.

This apartment is in a great location.  Just outside of the hustle and bustle of the middle of the city, but close enough to be able to walk anywhere and everywhere with ease!  Just a few blocks away from the public running path along the Hudson, which will take you up to Central Park, made this location a plus for me, being an active runner.  Karen is a great hostess and I would recommend this location to anyone looking to stay in NYC!

Karen's place was very cozy and cute, perfect for our short stay. There are essentially two rooms, a kitchen/dining and a bedroom, which was fine us. The place was clean and well kept. The bedroom contains a TV with Netflix and other apps, which was plus.  Karen was kind enough to provide plenty of bottled water and even bought us cereal and milk. She was also very communicative and quick to answer any of my questions. Though it was not awfully close to the subway, you are a 15 min walk to times square. Overall, lovely stay and a friendly host.

Great location, walking distance to bars and restaurants in Hell's Kitchen and near to Central Park and Times Square. Simple apartment with everything you need. A great place to stay for a weekend city break!
great location, cosy place

Karen was so fine always answer and she is helpful
It's was nice to stay in her house everything was so close (central park ,Times Square)

Exactly as advertised. Karen was wonderfully responsive and helpful with any questions I had. There was a little work being done during the day in the building (or in the neighboring one), but as I was out for most of my  time in NYC, it wasn't a problem.  

While it was noted, I totally missed the fact that there was  a resident cat in the apartment's description (note to those who are allergic), but he kept to himself and didn't shed as far as I noticed:) Karen left me her entire apartment, which was wonderful! 

I definitely recommend Karen's place to those who want a quiet night, about a 12-15min walk from Times Square:)

This was my wife and I's very first Air Bnb experience and it was the best outcome we could have hoped for. Karen was helpful from the moment we asked to stay in her place, to even after we left as she returned something we forgot. Her place was extremely clean and cozy, and has a really friendly cat who only comes around every now and then. The bed was so comfortable .. lol. The area is perfect, you can literally go up one block and you're on a street with so many restaurants. (5 Napkin Burger is amazing. Otto's Tacos are perfect for a late night snack.) Central Park and Times Square were only about a 15-20 minute walk, and the surrounding streets were really quiet. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a short, comfortable, fun  and inexpensive NYC stay. Thank you for everything Karen, you're a great host.
The apartment is in a very convenient spot, easily walkable to restaurants and public transportation. It was clean and cozy. Karen was also communicative, with a straightforward check-in/out process.
Great place and great value
Nice stay

Karen's place was perfect for a trip to the city. Within walking distance to Times Square and other tourist attractions. Karen's place was very clean and was very accommodating to our needs. Would definitely recommend!

Karen was very communicative and flexible throughout the checkin process. The apartment is very cozy and in an absolutely amazing location. It was perfect for my boyfriend and I and I would love to stay here again next time I'm in the city!

Karen cozy place is perfect place to stay If you want to visit all the touristy areas in NY everything is walkable ! We walked the whole time we stayed there! Tiger is such a friendly cat couldn't get enough of him !

My stay at Karen's was perfect, it was just what I was looking for. Here place was close to everything. I was able to walk to Time Square, Rockefeller plaza and the Intrepid Museum. Here place is also close to Subway location for further locations. The place was clean and Karen made the whole process from check in to checking  out very easy. I would definitely recommend her place.
Was very well coordinated & She was very flexible with the check in check out timings ... Full Privacy , gr88 location ...  feels like home !!
La posizione è ottima e Karen è stata perfetta nel check-in e check-out

Part of me doesn't want to write thus review.  I want to keep Karen's place my secret.  I hope to be able to be Karen's guest and over with no competition.  But in fairness to Karen and Tiger I will write my review.  

Karen's place consists of the most comfy bedroom and a big bright kitchen. There is no living room, but not missed.  The bathroom is interesting, separate spaces for the commode and shower but it works. 

The neighborhood is so interesting, and has great restaurants!
Karen’s location is perfect for travelers wanting a quiet place to rest after long days exploring the city.
Exactly as expected!
Great hospitality, location, and value. Walkable to more touristy locations but also near public transit. It was clean, too. I recommend!
Great location, host was amazing. Easily reachable and apartment was super clean!
Karen was fantastic! She communicated quickly and was really friendly.  We booked super last minute and she was very helpful & her kitty was really sweet. Highly recommend the space.
Great location walkable to everythin g.

Great place in the heart of Hell’s Kitchen. Clean, and bed was one of the most comfortable beds I’ve stayed at through Airbnb. Karen was very thoughtful with her guide, and even provided complimentary snacks. Would definitely stay again.
Great location, host communicated very quickly!
Good spot, close to all sorts of things to do in NYC.  Tiger the cat is a great co-host.
I enjoyed staying at Karen’s cozy apt right in Hell’s Kitchen. She replied promptly, the location was very convenient, and the price was affordable. Would def stay here again!

Place is perfect for two people. Place is small but Karen is very hospitable and she’s also very flexible on check in times and check out! It has everything necessary for any stay. Would recommend staying at this place.

Karen was a very gracious host, with quick responses and a apartment fully stocked with water and Gatorade. The location was pretty convenient- walking distance to a lot of attractions. We really enjoyed our stay and the company of Tiger too. Thanks Karen!
This place is amazing for single travelers or 2 people. Walkable distance to public transportation. Loved it!
This fucking bitch had a cat in tthe room, shit got me in the ER, i had to stay there all day to make sur i aint got shit in my body, This cat also take a shit on ur bed so be careful,
Clean and convenient

What a gem! We enjoyed our time at Karen's place (with Tiger!) so much. The place is exactly as described, and close to a lot of bars and restaurants. Check in couldnt have been easier, and Karen was kind enough to let us check in early as soon as we arrived in the city. Would highly recommend!
Great place in an awesome location!
The place was clean, centrally located, and exactly as described.
Good place, great location. The building/apartment is a bit on the older side. Tiger, the cat, is very friendly and playful.
Great host, very communicative and quick to respond.

Wonderful place to stay! Gives you a sense of “local life” and is in walking distance to great restaurants. Easy to maneuver around to popular areas of Times Square and Karen is quick to respond.  Loved this place!

Thanks Karen! 

I had a great stay and the neighborhood is fantastic. 

If anyone is worried about living with Tiger the cat for a few days, don't. I think I only saw him twice and he is super friendly. 

Highly recommend
Karen's apartment was great! We had a blast with Tiger and the location was amazing!
Would stay again

Such a great place to stay! LITERALLY WALKING DISTANCE TO TIMES SQUARE!!!  My boyfriend and I had the most amazing time in NYC it was so nice to be within walking distance from everything! And the cat is absolutely adorable! Loves to be cuddle doesn’t really like anything but his ears petted lol perfect for tourist visiting NYC and the place was very quiet and cool with AC very nice place to stay

Stayed at Karen’s apartment for a quick weekend trip and the location was amazing. So many fun bars, restaurants and shops nearby. Her apartment was cute and the bed was super comfy. The best part was her cat, Tiger! Thanks for such a wonderful stay!
Tucked away in Hell's Kitchen just steps away from the Hudson River, Karen's place had everything I needed for a last minute labor day stay in New York City!

El apartamento gozaba de todo lo necesario para una estancia agradable. La anfitriona nos dio todas las facilidades. Se encuentra a unos 15 minutos andando de Time Square así que la ubicación es muy adecuada.

Karen’s place was in a great location. Close to everything we wanted to do and see in NYC. Simple and equipped with everything you’d need for a short weekend in NYC. Also, her cat Tiger is the sweetest cat or even animal my boyfriend and I have ever come across. We loved him! We would honestly come back just for Tiger ❤️.

Cozy place and fantastic location! Walking distance to tons of great bars, restaurants, the MoMA, Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, the High Line, etc. We also really enjoyed the company of Tiger the cat.  Karen was very responsive and accommodating.

My boyfriend and I had an excellent stay at Karen's place. We didn't get to meet Karen, but she was very friendly, communicative, and hospitable. Her place was clean and had all the amenities that we needed. The location is unbeatable if you're looking to get a more touristy NYC experience (right next to Time Square and Broadway, very walkable to Central Park), which was perfect for us because it was my boyfriend's first time in NYC. We had an amazing time staying at Karen's! Her cat Tiger was a special touch. We loved him, and I usually don't like cats. We miss him already. :) Thanks Karen and Tiger!

Karen’s place was excellent. Make sure you’re aware that a cat lives here before booking, he is, however, very sweet and friendly. A fantastic location and Karen was communicative through the entire process.

Karen was awesome. She was easy to communicate with and her home was so easily accessible and convenient. She also made accommodations for us in regards to check in, which was really nice of her. Tiger was also a joy! (:  Thank you Karen!
Karen's apartment is definitely cozy but very nicely organized. All instructions were clearly posted and check in was easy. would definitely recommend!

Very clean.  Small but served its purpose. Definitely can’t have more than 2 people. Limited privacy as shower is separate from the bathroom (which only has a toilet - the only sink is in the kitchen).

This was such a lovely last-minute find! A little snug, but very cute and with nice surprising touches like free sparkling water in the fridge. The check-in/check-out process was extremely convenient and easy and Karen was always very communicative. Also, we fell in love with her cat, one of the sweetest and cuddliest I've ever encountered.

Karen’s apartment is located amazingly close to the ideal tourist attractions. Within minutes of Times Square but near enough to local amazing eateries you are spoiled for choice. Tiger the cat is a star and we became best friends of course!
Walking around New York City is so easy from Karen’s and she can recommend great places. 
The local pizza joints are super, links to transport fantastic and also near to uss intrepid museum if that “floats your boat” 
Everything provided for you quirky apartment always felt safe and the neighbors are lovely. The key pick up is super easy and literally takes seconds to collect and drop off. Out from the deli turn left and 1 block left again you are at the apartment. 
Amazing stay amazing host 
Thanks so much! 
Love from London

name: Designer Apartment in Sheung Wan
summary: We live in a beautiful and spacious one bedroom apartment in the heart of Sheung Wan.  Lots of natural light and an open view over trees on Hollywood Road and the Man Mo Temple. We are close enough to the action whilst still being in a quiet spot, a rare find!
description: We live in a beautiful and spacious one bedroom apartment in the heart of Sheung Wan.  Lots of natural light and an open view over trees on Hollywood Road and the Man Mo Temple. We are close enough to the action whilst still being in a quiet spot, a rare find! Often described as the new SOHO, there are chic coffee shops and international gourmet restaurants as well as small street side dai pai dongs, up market boutiques and antique shops as well as traditional Chinese medicine and dried food shops – the best of both worlds where old meets new. The area is well served by minibuses, City Bus, taxis, and the old style Hong Kong tram. The MTR is a two minute walk from the flat. Many bus routes run along Des Voeux Road and Queens Road West and though many streets are too steep or narrow for buses, some minibus routes travel through the upper streets.
neighborhood_overview: Often described as the new SOHO, there are chic coffee shops and international gourmet restaurants as well as small street side dai pai dongs, up market boutiques and antique shops as well as traditional Chinese medicine and dried food shops – the best of both worlds where old meets new.
transit: The area is well served by minibuses, City Bus, taxis, and the old style Hong Kong tram. The MTR is a two minute walk from the flat. Many bus routes run along Des Voeux Road and Queens Road West and though many streets are too steep or narrow for buses, some minibus routes travel through the upper streets.

address.street: Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: I had a wonderful stay at Maria's.   I have stayed at many apartments in HK on Airbnb over the last years and this one is definitely in my top 5.  Lovely place, very comfortable, felt like home, extremely central and close to the metro, restaurants and shops.   From the beginning the communication with Maria was very easy despite that we were both in different countries and she was very accommodating and nice.  I would highly recommend Maria's place and hope to stay there on one of my next visits to HK.

Very lovely and clean flat. We've stayed 4 nights in Marias flat and really enjoyed it. Maria has sent us detailed Infos in advance and she always replied very quickly on my mails. Will definetely recommend her flat to my friends. :)

I didn't get to see Maria but it seems we know more about each other than what we thought ;) She has been very responsive to all my requests.
Place is really good, clean, well equipped (maybe missing a dehumidifier to have better nights), bed is gorgeous. Nothing to say about the location, you have it all at an arm reach. Will i come back? for sure!

The apartment was conveniently located, close to everything from bars, restaurants, grocery stores and great shopping on Gough street. Maria's apartment is just as it appears in the photos and she was an incredible host -- very responsive and helpful. I'd definitely stay here again next time I'm in Hong Kong

Maria's place is perfect! Great communication. Place to pick-up the keys so it was easy check-in. 
The apartment is located less than five minutes walk from Sheung Wan  MRT station (which is also just a 25 mins train ride from the airport.)
The location is perfect. In city center. Take the train or walk on Queens Road. Lots and lots of cafes, coffee shops, and restaurants. 
The apartment is on the 15th floor (elevator.) One bedroom, living room, bath, and a functional small kitchen to cook simple to semi-complex meals. Lots of natural light. Large HD TV and decent wi-fi. 
Everything is great! Highly recommend.
great
The apartment is in very convenient location , so easy to get everywhere. Thanks Maria to make my stay very comfortable

My husband and I spent 5 nights at Maria’s place and we had a really lovely stay!!  With the caveat that many HK apartments are relatively small, Maria’s place was certainly big enough for a couple.  Two key things:  the bathroom had ample hot/cold water and the bed was super comfortable.  We didn’t cook anything, but the kitchen was well-stocked and there’s a small grocery store just next to the apartment. The location is great – two blocks from a metro station, near the trolley / bus lines, right below Man Mo Temple, and about a 15-20 minute walk to Central, Soho, and the piers.  There’s a great dim sum place about a block north and wonderful older streets, with traditional shops selling ginseng and dried seafood are all nearby.  Maria was very responsive before arrival and during our stay.  Overall highly recommended!

Maria's apartment was great and was a helpful host. 
Location, location, location, it is located it heart of everything, bars, restaurants, coffee shops and supermarket conveniently located down stairs. 
We had a great time Maria, thank you very much.

I think Maria is probably the best and most accommodating host that I have ever stayed with. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

thanks!

We had a fantastic experience in the Sheung Wan area of Hong Kong Island.  There is everything you need within a short distance of the apartment.  The apartment is sizeable enough for 2 people and is a safe haven away from home after the chaos that Hong Kong often supplies!  Transport is close by, restaurants are in abundant supply, and the locals are usually helpful and happy if you are spending money.  The antique markets are a short walk away and there are some fantastic tea rooms just around the corner.  Loved the area and the apartment.  Thank you Maria for allowing us to experience Hong Kong as the locals do
It was a comfortable stay at Maria's flat and we really enjoy everything here; It's clean, spacious for a couple, convenient location. Thanks Maria for making us a great experience in HK.

Maria's home is gorgeous. I was after a weekend getaway from work in Manila and it was perfectly suited. Clean, tidy, excellent location and quiet for metro Hong Kong. Maria was easy to contact and clarified any questions I had. I loved my stay in Sheung Wan and will definitely be back!
Maria's thought of everything a guest in the city might need.

Maria’s place is spacious, well decorated, very comfy (bed makes you want to do pjay days every day), and superbly located. 
You’re staying in a real home, which makes it really nice. 
I highly recommend Maria’s apartment

This apt could not have a better location — it’s about a 15 min walk from Central and right in the heart of Sheung wan, which is itself a lovely neighborhood. There are tons of cute cafes, restaurants, and shops a stone throw’s away. Be aware though that Sheung wan is extremely hilly, with lots of stairs. The MTR station is very close — a straight walk down Hilier st, which is right in front of the apt. No hills or stairs on this walk! I should also say that cabs are very easy to find in front of the apt, and quite cheap and reliable. Cabbies often don’t speak English but we showed our destination on (Hidden by Airbnb) maps, and this worked great every time. 

The apt itself was small by our Wisconsin standards but probably quite large by HK standards. It was clean and cozy and perfectly fine. It was surprisingly quiet for being in such a bustling neighborhood. The bathroom and kitchen were small (but we didn’t need to cook or even shop for groceries considering all the amazing food options nearby) and there was little storage for our stuff. But for two people it was great and we had such a wonderful time there. Nothing but lovely memories. 

Maria missed our initial Airbnb request because she was traveling, but once we got a hold of her she was super responsive and helpful. 

We had such a happy stay in HK. Thank you Maria for providing a great home base.
Great place all around!
Terrific in all senses!

name: Private Cozy Bedroom in Brooklyn
summary: Your private room is located in our family's lovely 3-bedroom condo, a welcoming space for you to call home while enjoying all that New York's five boroughs have to offer. We are artists and students of culture and will be happy to help with recommendations during your stay. We also have another bedroom listing with more space: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/135393?s=8&user_id=663764&ref_device_id=834476da76042c7d3d85486a5eaac86e8cc4de3b
space: To yourself, you'll have a cozy room furnished with a comfortable and adjustable Ikea bed that pulls out from a twin to become a double. Your room also has a small refrigerator/freezer. yay! Clean sheets, blankets, pillows, and shampoo/conditioner are provided, as well as fresh towels and some closet space. (There are no additional charges for these items.) (Note: When set-up as a double, the bed will take up most of the space in the room, though you may push it back into a twin for more space during the day.)  We provide you with your own set of house keys, including for your private room.  We don't impose a curfew so you're welcome to come and go as you like -- make yourself at home! There is one bathroom in the unit with a sink, toilet, and shower/tub to be used by all.  While communication about timing for the use of the bathroom for morning and evening schedules is always beneficial, we have never had any issues sharing this space with guests. You are also welcome to share the oth
description: Your private room is located in our family's lovely 3-bedroom condo, a welcoming space for you to call home while enjoying all that New York's five boroughs have to offer. We are artists and students of culture and will be happy to help with recommendations during your stay. We also have another bedroom listing with more space: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/135393?s=8&user_id=663764&ref_device_id=834476da76042c7d3d85486a5eaac86e8cc4de3b To yourself, you'll have a cozy room furnished with a comfortable and adjustable Ikea bed that pulls out from a twin to become a double. Your room also has a small refrigerator/freezer. yay! Clean sheets, blankets, pillows, and shampoo/conditioner are provided, as well as fresh towels and some closet space. (There are no additional charges for these items.) (Note: When set-up as a double, the bed will take up most of the space in the room, though you may push it back into a twin for more space during the day.)  We provide you with your own set of house k
neighborhood_overview: Please check our Guidebook to see recommendations for places to visit in our neighborhood!
notes: PLEASE NOTE: when the Ikea day bed is pulled out into a double there is a weight limit of 225lbs per person. ADDITIONALLY: We have another private bedroom in our home also listed on Airbnb. We verify all our guests through the site and guests will have keys to lock their bedroom doors. We find most guests rarely meet as everyone is out seeing the city! If you are interested in checking out our other room, please use the following link: https://airbnb.com/rooms/135393?s=8&user_id=663764&ref_device_id=834476da76042c7d3d85486a5eaac86e8cc4de3b
transit: Our apartment is one block away from the 2 and 5 express subway lines, which can take you to Downtown Manhattan (Battery Park, Wall St, etc) in 20-25 minutes, to Mid-town Manhattan in 30-40 min, and to many of Brooklyn's best sites in just 10-15 minutes. (Note: directions will be provided by AirBnb on the itinerary you are sent following booking.)
access: Our home includes: - high-speed Wi-Fi - large washer & dryer - bathtub/shower - fully-equipped kitchen - living & dining room - Apple TV with Hulu, Netflix, & HBO - library of books and vast movie & music collection - hardwood floors throughout
interaction: We have been hosting on Airbnb since 2011 and have really enjoyed sharing our home with visitors from other cities and countries   Since we don't travel as much now that we have children we love that people from all over bring the flavors of their culture into our home when they come to stay with us.  ;) We are friendly and would be happy to share our love of New York with you during your stay. With our backgrounds as a licensed NYC tour guide and a member of multiple theatrical and performance unions, as well as our own general passions and interests, we are very knowledgeable about theatre, film, jazz, art and science museums, public parks, historical and cultural landmarks and other ins-and-outs about the city, and we would be glad to give you tips on (for example) standby tickets for The Book of Mormon, the best options for Monday night jazz, or how to get discounted entry to the Met and other museums. If our schedules allow and guests have an interest, we welcome conversation over
house_rules: Our apt is 2k. When you arrive, buzz 2k from the lobby! Once inside the apartment, please take off your shoes and leave them by the front door. Whenever you leave our home or return, please lock the front door behind you.  Our home is strictly non-smoking.  Please do not take any showers between 645am and 745am as we need to get in and out of the bathroom to get kids off to school.  If you are using the AC in your room, just make sure and turn it off when leaving for the day. (Unless you'll only be gone a short while. It's just too expensive to cool an empty room!) Also, please turn off lights in your room if you are leaving for a significant amount of time. If you would like to use the washer and dryer, please talk to me first. Our washer uses concentrated soap and the dryer filter needs to be changed before each load. Let me show you the basics (soap, filter, etc.) It'll be quick and easy. ;) (Here's a suggestion, Not a rule ;) If you arrive into JFK or LGA, take a cab not an Uber. U

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Joshua is a writer originally from the Atlantic City area and Karen is an actress,designer,improviser originally from a small town in southeastern Oklahoma. We love film, theatre, music, travel, and nyc and are always up for a lively discussion! We have been hosting on Airbnb since 2011 and really enjoy the opportunity to host such a wide variety of guests!

reviews.comments: The reservation was canceled 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This was our second time staying with Karen and her family.  As was our previous experience, Karen was a great host, the room was clean and set up for us.  Karen is super helpful, always offering great advice and her place is very close to the subway. 

We returned specifically because of our great experience last time and we would definitely do it again!
Karen & Joshua are great hosts! Very helpful, easy going, open minded and respectful. The apartment is nice and near the subway. So lovely family! Thank you!!!

We enjoyed our stay at Karen and Joshua's. They had lots of tips and advices about what to do and see.
Placed closed to the subway and Prospect Park, made it a perfect location for us.
The family was talkative, but respectfully to the need of privacy.

Karen and Joshua were great hosts. Eventhough we only booked the room a couple of hours before our check-in, everything was arranged perfectly. Everything is exactly as described. The house was clean, neat and close to the subway.

We were happy we could stay with this lovely family. When we go back to New York we would definitely stay here again! Thank you Karen and Joshua.

L'ambiance du quartier nous a au début un peu surpris mais finalement aucun problème. Nos hôtes on été très accueillant même en arrivant a 1h du matin! 2 charmants bambins et un couple disponible mais pas dans nos pattes ce qui nous a permis d'aller et venir à notre guise !
Merci à eux

Karen and Joshua were fantastic hosts! I staid a short three nights. They were flexible, kind, respectful and reliable. No problem for checking in, even if I was delayed because of the bus. No rush for the check out. The room and the bed were comfortable, clean, quite perfect for what I was looking for. And for sure, having groceries, a train station and restaurants near their place was great. Nothing to complain, I appreciated my stay.

Karen and Joshua were very welcoming, and helpful when it came to information about travel, what to do and our arrival and departure times. Despite being not that close to Manhattan, and being quite small for 2 people, it was perfect for our stay. Having WiFi also made our stay very easy.

I enjoyed my stay with Karen and Joshua. They were both very kind and helped me with directions for getting around the city when I needed it. It was my second time being in New York City and my first time using Airbnb and I'm glad everything worked out smoothly.
Everything was completely fine. Hosts were very hospitable.

Karen and Joshua could not have been more gracious hosts. As advertised, they offered a private and very cozy room and gave full access to their kitchen and facilities.  They were friendly and seemed always ready to be of help if I needed it.  Moreover, they had it worked out almost to the last detail:  when I arrived they already had neat packages, clearly labelled, of take-out menus for area restaurants, they had directions to local shops and businesses - all of which were in walking distance, and they had clear directions to the nearby subways, and there was a list of house rules - none of which were unacceptable. Overall, it was like spending a weekend at a friend's place.  The neighborhood was quite busy with people and shops until late into the night, but the room was quiet, clean and comfortable.  I slept like a baby.  I would only suggest that you confirm your check in and check out times with them in advance so as to avoid any confusion. I would stay here again if I needed to take another trip to NYC in the future - for sure.

Me and my friend had a very pleasant stay with Karen and Joshua and their two lovely children. It was very special to mingle with this beautiful American family and household. The bed we slept in was more than comfortable and we experienced a lot of space in sharing the kitchen and bathroom. Highly recommended! Great neighborhood too!

My Mom and I had a stop over in NY and stayed at Karen's for one night and it was very nice. I already stayed at Karens place last year and so it was my first choice. The room is clean and the bed is very comfortable. The neighborhood has some nice places to eat and the subway is just around the corner. Karen and Joshua are super nice and Belle and Crockett are really adorable. We enjoyed our short stay and I would definitely stay there again.

Karen and her husband are very nice people and it was a pleasure to stay with them. They were very friendly, helpful and easy-going.

Everything was the way they had depicted it in the description. No bad surprises. The room and the apartment were clean and cosy.

If I should come back to NY, I would try to stay with them again.

Karen had a very quick reaction time when we needed a place to stay last-minute. The room, while small for two people, is inexpensive for the New York area. We were up and about every day we were there though, so it was not a problem. If you are not planning on staying indoors for too long, we would definitely recommend this place!

When we first exited the subway, we found the neighborhood to be somewhat intimidating, though it was later at night. Nothing happened to us, even though we came home late every night. Could be that we just needed to get used to it a little at first.

Karen and Josh were great hosts, talking to us at length on the 
subject of New York and other destinations. Very friendly people.

The room was exactly as described. A nice cozy, comfortable bed to rest my head in between venturing out into Brooklyn and beyond. Karen and Josh were very hospitable and gracious and their kids were awesome too! 
Thanks so much!!!
Appartement très proche du métro et donc très pratique ,hôtes sympatiques et accueillants .Grand lit confortable mais qui occupe presque toute la chambre ...

I stayed 3 nights at Karen and was really happy with my stay. The bedroom was tiny but nice and clean and the apartment very close to the subway and grocery / drugstore / etc. Karen and her husband are kind, respectful and helpful. I would definitely go back and recommend staying with them! 

Je suis restée 3 nuits et j'ai beaucoup apprécié mon séjour. La chambre était petite mais propre et charmante et l'appartement vraiment près du métro et des services. Karen et son maris sont gentils, respectueux et très serviables. J'y retournerais et recommanderais de rester avec eux!

I had a great stay at Karen place and her family. She is very kind and available. She makes you really confortable. Her family is really lovely!
It's easy to go to Manhattan from her place.
I recommend this place to everyone who want to visit New-York.
Thanks

Our stay at Karen´s place was totally with no problems. She was very helpfull, the room was clean and the whole family is friendly. Have no negative feedback, it is also good reachable with the subway.
