Thank you once again Michelle, our stay was the best experience we could have asked for. Hope to see you soon in Brazil!

Wenn Ihr gut aufgehoben sein und schnell auf der Subway sein möchtet und eine aufmerksame, freundliche und Aufmerksam Vermieterin haben möchtet... Ja dann seit Ihr richtig bei Michelle. Wir waren sehr gerne in dieser Wohnung. Wasser und Süssigkeiten waren bereits in der Wohnung für uns reserviert... somit ein optimaler Ort bzw Wohnung

Michelle was an incredible host! She was there to help us with directions and what to do in the neigborhood. Parking is available immediately in front of the house! I will definitely recommend her place to all my friends and relatives and I would definitely rent it again.
Michelle was kind and very attentive to our every needs! Her place was exactly as described and the transportation is great. You will need 20 mins to be in Times square! Hope you will enjoy her place as much as we did!

Thank you Michelle for being the fantastic host you are!!!

Michelle is a great host! She waited us for check-in until 10:00 pm helped us for living in NY. She always respond my text within seconds and it was very helpful! 
The apartment is very clean, with spacious room for 3 people. It is also very quiet for rest.
I am so happy I could have a chance to book and live in her apartment!
very  nice appartment. nice backyard. close to public transportatio/subway

O local da Michelle é bastante aconchegante e em um lugar tranquilo no Brooklin. O metrô linhe G está na esquina e em meia hora, em conexão com a linha L, você está na Union Square em Manhattan. La casa de michelle se encuentra muy bien comunicada con el metro distancia aproximada a manhattan unos 40 minutos

Michelle is a fabulous host, she makes you feel comfortable and she is very helpful. Her appartment is spotless clean and beautifully decorated. It is located in a nice neighbourhood and it is very easy to reach Manhattan by subway. I would definitely recommend this place.

El departamento es muy cómodo, las camas son muy confortables y tiene lo necesario para una estancia placentera. A metros del subte, lo cual es invalorable cuando uno llega cansado de tanto caminar. Lo volvería a elegir.
The house is warm and perfect for a couple as for a family. Bedford in Brooklyn is the perfect logistic solution to visit Ny! Michelle is kind and always available for suggestions and support.

Michelle's place is very nice and centrally located in Brooklyn, very close to subway station.  She was very welcoming and there were nice touches like some food already in the fridge for breakfast and all the amenities.  I would definitely stay there again!

Hospitality was amazing, Michelle really makes you feel at home. This cozy place was perfect, being at ground level helped, no carrying of heavy luggage up stairs. 
Location is perfect, metro system 2 minutes walk away with local eateries and convenience store down the street. Overall, great experience, highly recommended.
Great spot!

El departamento es muy agradable , acogedor , y Michelle nos hizo sentir como en casa .

Michelle‘s apartment is amazing. It is in the heart of Bedford Stuyvesant and convenient to most of Brooklyn. It is a cozy hideaway that I cannot recommend enough. Michelle has stocked it with everything a traveler might need.  There is abundant on street parking and restaurants on every corner.
We spent 4 nights in Michelle's place and we loved our stay. Michelle is lovely and the apartment is very cosy. We felt immediately at home !

Michelle treated us like family members. During her warm welcome she explained everything about the house and the neighborhood, offered us something to eat (even arriving almost midnight). It was all I was expected to: well located, just near the subway, and typically new yorker.  And Brooklyn is the place to be!

All our friendship from Paris, France.

Michelle was an amazing host! Really quick to reply, helpful and accommodating. Her place is a great little apartment exactly as pictured, and was a perfect, cozy base for me while in NY.
我非常喜欢Michelle的房源,出行方便,距离地铁G线非常近,房间干净整洁｡除了偶尔有一些地铁的声音,但是并不会打扰休息｡

Un departamento con todo lo que se necesita. Michelle pensó en todo. Excelente comunicación. Excelente ubicación. Departamento mejor que incluso en las fotos. Siempre con mucha disposición para apoyarnos en nuestras dudas. Volvería sin pensarlo.

Michelle was a wonderful host and the Airbnb worked great.  The TV selection was wonderful too-my friend and I enjoyed watching old school MTV Classic.  Location is in a great location near the subway and also a good grocery store called Bravo around the corner.  Highly recommended.

Michelle est une hôte exceptionnelle. Elle nous a énormément facilité notre voyage à New York. Elle est extrêmement sympathique et réactive. Le logement est parfait. C'est un vrai coup de cœur!

-сырость, поскольку это неполноценный первый этаж, а между подвалом и первым этажом
-подземка в НЮ неглубокая, а метро близко, поэтому высокая слышимость поездов под тобой)

What a wonderfull stay, thank you for your kindness.
Michelle was always available to answer your questions and help you.
Thoughtful touches and everything you might need for a stay in Brooklyn! Michelle’s spot was perfect and I’d highly recommend it!

Michelle's apartment is comfortable, clean, and convenient to the metro, nice restaurants, delis, and wine stores.   The neighborhood feels safe, and is interesting...diverse, and a mixture of old and new.   Michelle is a welcoming and considerate host.   We'd definitely stay here again if we come back to the New York area.
Excelente ubicación, a metros del Metro G, que te conecta con todo Manhattan, el Departamento es sumamente cómodo, la anfitriona es super educada y agradable, con muy buena predisposición.

Michelle was very nice and eager to help. The apartment is on the basement floor, with access to private yard (which we never used due to weather). Place itself is rather ok, very close to subway, which makes it a great value. Though the neighborhood was a bit concerning-construction next door, so don’t be surprised to see rats on street.

Michelle was a wonderful host during our stay in her apartment. We felt so welcome, and well taken care of during the entire stay. The apartment was also really good, nice and clean, with everything you need.  Subway station almost right outside the door, with 24/7 service.

Michelle is a really nice host. She gave us a lot of advices and helped us a lot. The house is warm and clean, we enjoyed our stay for 7 days. 2 min walk to the subway station which is fantastic! I will definitely recommend this house. Thank you Michelle :)
房间是整栋小别墅的一楼,房东把一切都收拾的整洁干净,并且提供了很多贴心的物品,令人很温暖｡距离地铁站超级近!!出站后走2分钟就能到,非常方便｡纽约的冬天很冷,但是房间里很暖和,夜里甚至会热醒｡Michelle人非常好,最后一天还主动问我们要不要把行李寄存在她的家里(她住在二楼),真的帮了大忙｡总之性价比非常高,强烈推荐｡
Situación, perfecta. La casa, en general, bien.

Everything about Michele‘s apartment was an A+ great communicator and very lovely host. My wife and I felt at home in her comfortable, clean, and fully stocked apartment. Great location plenty of eateries, deli’s, and G train a couple of minutes away. Very thankful for accommodating us with our luggage prior to checking in/out (especially the check out time 12 p.m.) and enjoyed the special treat she left for us. We would love to stay at her place in the future and highly, highly recommended Michelle’s apartment. Thank you for allowing us to reside in your apartment.

Michelle was an amazing host - very friendly & responsive.  There was a lot of little touches which added to our holiday eg. milk and doughnuts in the fridge on arrival.  Apartment was very clean and close to the subway, which made getting into NYC really easy.  There is a supermarket next to the subway which had everything we needed for during our visit.  We had a very late flight and Michelle stored our luggage for the day as well as arranging a taxi to the airport.  I highly recommend and would stay again next time I'm in NY.

Amazing place. It's beautiful with lots of character, has everything you need for stay away from home. From a fully equipped kitchen and bathroom, recommendations of things to do from Michelle, transportation just two minute walk to subway station. Plus Michelle is very kind and helpful, she made my stay much comfortable.

host.host_about: I am a retired veteran.

reviews.comments: The host canceled this reservation 23 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

When we arrived at Tom's house, he was busy. But in the evening, his wife and little boy came to the house to show and explain about the house equipment. She was very kindly!
The house was clean. Kitchen was well equiped and spacious.
We enjoyed fishing at the lake behind of the house. We really enjoyed holidays.
Thanks Tom!

When I first booked this place it was advertised as an entire house with three bedrooms, a large kitchen, a nice dining room, washer, dryer, back yard and hot tub. When I got there, I was surprised to see that the owner had split the house into two rentals – an upstairs unit and a downstairs unit – and had relegated to only the upstairs unit: two bedrooms, a mini kitchen (small modified entry hallway), with NO large kitchen, no dining room whatsoever, no washer, dryer, back yard or hot tub.

The half of the house that we had access to was very nice. Light wood floors with plenty of closet storage, two bathrooms, and a mini kitchen. There were two TVs (one had Netflix only while the other had a few stations). There are four beds – the two bedroom beds were nice and comfy whereas the two living area “beds” (couch/beds) were like slightly cushioned wood planks. My daughter tried sleeping there the first night and said never again. The air conditioner worked very well. And the view from the unit was spectacular. The house is right on the lake (Enchanted Lake) and sunrises were beautiful.

The house is in Kailua, a sleepy little town on the east side of Oahu. The Kailua beach is only minutes away and is one of the nicest beaches on Oahu. There was no boogie board and no beach towels provided by the owner but Target was only a few minutes away. 

Sound was an issue. Because of the way the house was divided, we could hear every word our “neighbors” were saying. In our case, the neighbors were super loud and didn’t sleep until 2-3 am every night.

The owner said we could use the washer and dryer in the garage but that we’d have to literally enter the other renter’s unit and walk through their dining room (what should have been our dining room) to get to the garage. We didn’t feel comfortable with that so we didn’t.

There was no hot tub on the property.

Despite getting only half the house, we made the most of our Hawaii adventure and had a wonderful time.

This is a great locations for adults looking for a party location in beautiful Kailua. Not ideal for families. Kailua is the ideal location for families! Kailua Beach is the most beautiful beach on the island with white soft sand and light waves. I loved the town and the location of the bond was close to town, Bellows AFB beaches, the Sandy Beach breathtaking coastline and Hanauma Bay. The house was very clean and neat. The decor was relaxing and the kitchen was well stocked. However this home is NOT ideal for families. There is not a dining area (table) for meals, there is not a backyard(as it is for the lower unit), and there is not direct access to laundry (which is coin operated). Tom was very pleasant and responsive via text or Airbnb messaging. Regretfully, he never met with us during our 13 day visit. He was not there to greet us are our arrival or departure. That made things difficult because we were very surprised to learn that the washer and dryer was not in our unit. We had to enter the kitchen of the downstairs unit to access the garage to do laundry. Unfortunately, the washer water emptied in the utility sink which overflowed on the floor due to a malfunction in the plumbing. This happen on day 3 and never was fixed during our 13 day stay. We were forced to use a local laundry mat.This was very inconvenient because we selected this home for this amenity as we were a family of 8 on a 13-day vacation. We didn't have a linen set for s second couch pullout. I requested it the first night and never received it. We made due by stealing pieces from other beds. The advertising for the home is misleading. It causes one to believe that the backyard is for this unit, there is a dining area, and that laundry is an amenity for this unit. Rather, the backyard is for the lower unit whose front door is the entryway to the backyard. The lower unit is set up as a bachelor pad and is rented by large groups of adults looking for a good time in Hawaii. The lanai is set up with 3 indoor couches, numerous misfit dining chairs, 2 lounge chairs, and a patio set for 4. This set up is not as the picture shows which is a low key back lanai with one patio set. There was lots of drinking and loud partying into late hours of the evening. This was not ideal for my family which included young children and an infant. I would like to not that Tom was very responsive at our complaint for loud noise past 11pm but this did not eliminate the loud partying on future nights. Lastly, Tom did not inform us that there would be roof work being done to install solar panels beginning at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) for 4 days. No sleeping in those days on our vacation! I...

We loved this beautiful home. It was immaculate, bright, cheerful and in a peaceful, friendly and welcoming neighborhood. I felt very safe there. The host, Tom, was very helpful. He brought us fresh towels when we needed them and he was very friendly. He got back to me right away when I had questions. It was a wonderful experience and we would gladly stay at this property again, and also would highly recommend it to others.

The description of the home is exactly what you see, there are two options for the home the upstairs or downstairs. We really enjoyed the home we stayed in the upstairs unit with a beautiful view.  The location is prime its in the middle of the island really cant go wrong. There is a lake in the backyard where we finished and crabbed, however we would not advise eating since the water is not tested for bacteria, you can (Hidden by Airbnb) and read for yourself. The fun is catch and realse :) The area is very safe and I had the chance to speak with the residents near b,y very friendly and informative about the area. We never used the laundry but it is easily accessible for both units you no longer have to go through the other home, it has its own enclosure. Bring your own beach towels as they are not provided but not a big deal since target is 5 minute drive! There are many restaurants near by and shopping centers so its a huge bonus. There's a Costco about 20 minutes away its worth the drive, not only do you save money but the view is beautiful ! The host Tom was very nice and accommodating. Our family had a wonderful and memorable time in Hawaii we recommend staying here with your family, its a great place for your kids as well.

This house was a perfect rental for the week for me and my buddy. Both of us were from out of state (CA and FL) and attending a wedding nearby.  The location of the house was about perfect for us, being both close to where the wedding was as well as close to town and a little bit of local nightlife (we were about to walk home from Kailua in about 20-25 minutes one night after going out). Kailua is a decent city about a 5 min drive away with pretty much everything you'll need close to you (Target, Safeway, Wholefoods, shopping, restaurants, and some decent little dive bars). 

My only complaint about this place was really just a simple mix up with the initial access into the property. The day before I arrived I was given an access code to the front door. When I arrived I used the code given and quickly realized after multiple attempts that the code was not the right code. After about 30 mins of trying to contact the owner I finally got a response to come reset the code. Unfortunately he was at work so his wife was going to have to come do it. Long story short, it took 3 hours after his initial response before his wife was able to make it over to reset it. From the moment I got there I had to wait about 3.5 hours to actually get into the house, which isn't the most fun to do when trying to get changed in clothes that are more suited for the heat and humidity (jeans and long sleeve shirt may be appropriate for the airport I departed from, but not for flying into Honolulu). So about 3.5 hours of being sweaty and miserable trying to kill time in town before being able to change.

That being said, the rest of the property was very clean, decently furnished, and the quality of the house and amenities is what I would consider to be average for the houses in the area, which is to say that yes it was a nice place. 

I give the house 4 stars out of 5 because of the mixup of the entry access code and long response time. Otherwise I would probably say closer to 4.5 stars as far as how the property's profile vs reality was. I would recommend this property to a friend and I would consider staying here again.

ｶｲﾙｱの町から車で3分位ととても利便性のいい場所です｡
一軒家の2階部分の貸し切りでした｡最初入り方が分からなくて何度もお仕事中のTomさんに電話を描けてしまいました｡丁寧に説明してくれるのですが､私の英語力が乏しくて分かりませんでした｡
すると､何と❗わざわざ40分かけてTomさんのお父さんが家まで来てくれました｡本当にお世話になりました｡
夏なのでｴｱｺﾝがないと生きていけない!とこの物件を選びしたが､実際は風通しも良くて窓を開けてると充分快適です｡

Tom was a terrific host.  My family - wife and 2 boys (10 and 7) visited Kailua for our vacation and found lots of room at Tom's place.  Very clean and well kept.  Very convenient location near the highway to Honolulu and close to the central part of Kailua.  Thanks again for a great stay Tom!

I feel this is not Airbnb quality.  It seems to be a clumsy attempt to use the upstairs of a family home as temporary quarters.  It would best be used as a low rent apartment.  The "kitchen" was a cook top and refrigerator in the apparent side entrance foyer.  The upstairs bathrooms are down the hall from the rooms and show long use by kids.
The host, whom we didn't meet, was eager and communicated with us frequently.  This may have been his first try at using Airbnb.

I love Tom house location. Very safe, and nice walking neighborhood. His house is absolutely beautiful and clean. I would definitely book this place again for future vacations. However, the door by the kitchen and stairs could use a better sound proofs insulation. During our last two nights stayed, our downstairs neighbor were very loud and drinking passed midnight.  We pretty much could hear everything from downstairs. Thank you Tom for the wonderful place you provided us.
Overall great place.

Tom was an excellent host. Although we never had a chance to meet it was easy to get a hold of him. He provided the door access before hand and we had no issues getting in. The space was perfect for 6 people with 2 bathrooms. The location is also a quick drive to everything you may need.

It was a nice home and certainly a better value than a hotel. It is adjacent to a nice lagoon, and the neighborhood is quiet. It is close to downtown Kailua and all the shops, if you've rented a car. If you don't rent a car, you'll walk or bike a decent way to get around. The kitchen was small but usable. The beds were comfortable. It was definitely very clean and complete. This is an upstairs unit which is quite roomy; there's also a downstairs unit which he rents, and on our last night there, the people staying we're extremely loud until well past 2AM, but I'm sure they've left by now.
We had a great time. The place was beautiful and central to shops and town.

Overall I'd give Tom's house 4 out of 5 stars! Tom was incredibly easy to work with and very responsive to any questions we had! The location of the home was perfect for what we needed. Close enough to Kailua's center to drive there in less than 5 minutes. Would probably be a 15 minute walk and quick bike ride. The house is on Enchanted Lake and that was both a pro and con. The view was great, the cool air flow coming across the lake helped keep the house comfortable, and we saw lots of ducks/birds. The con was that it got a little smelly but that's no fault of Tom's obviously. One bummer was that unit is on the 2nd floor of what was obviously a single family home. So as an upstairs guest there is no access to the backyard or the water front. The property is also located right on a semi-busy road so there was traffic and noise throughout the day and night. The road was convenient though. Quick access to Hamakua and to Kalanianaole hwy. The property had two large bedrooms, both with comfortable King sized Temperpedic mattresses. The bedding was comfortable as well. Each bedroom, as well as the living room, had air conditioning units. We used the bedroom units at night only, and were very comfortable and it drowned out the noise from the street (when there was noise). The overall cleanliness of the house was adequate but not impressive. It wasn't dirty but there were remnants of the last tenants - like hair. It wasn't unmanageable but not fun to deal with. One shower was pretty molded but we didn't even use that shower so it wasnt a problem. Of course we came across ants in the bathrooms but it didn't bother us a bit. As former residents of Kailua, we knew that ants are just part of the territory. We simply made sure to keep food in air tight containers or in the fridge. One con for us was that the temperature of the water in the showers was always hot. No matter how cold we turned the dial (all the way) the water was hot. This was not the case for the sinks though. This made it difficult for us to bathe our two small children, but we made it work by adding cold water from the sink to the bath. One different thing about the property is that the very small kitchen is located downstairs while the rest of the unit is upstairs. It wasn't a problem for us because we ate most of our meals at a friend's house or out. There are kitchenware provided but for us it seemed difficult to cook. The kitchen also is right outside of a bedroom for a downstairs guest. Sound proofing between the two units in this area could be improved. I know that we were sometimes bothered by the noisy guests coming in late, or hanging out in the...
Tom was a very good host! A great guy! He answered all our questions and fixed one or two little problems we had very fast!!

We were very pleased with our decision to stay in Kailua. This part of the island has beautiful lush and green vegetation and trees, with a peaceful pace and very friendly locals.
The description of this home was very accurate. We found the home clean, located near all amenities and the public beach is just a 5 minute drive away.
Tom was very helpful and he replies to every communication promptly.
Awesome!

Great place, great location. A short drive or long walk to the beach. Grocery stores and other shops are also very nearby. The place was clean and orderly when I arrived, also coordinating with Tom was easy as he was very responsive to all of my questions.
Nice location but upstairs “unit” definitely not fit for a party of 7!!!

There was so much this place offered. It is located in one of the best parts of Oahu. It is located within a mile of ,stores like Whole foods, gas stations, Safeway, restaurants, and two of the most upscale gorgeous beaches.  It is also a very quick car ride to the amazing Nupali and within 30 minutes to Waikiki Beach, the airport  as well as Kualoa Ranch and Central Oahu. It was a very safe and clean neighborhood and the house itself is parked right up against a beautiful lake that can be seen from every room.  I had the pleasure of meeting the owners of this home. From the very start he impressed me with making sure we got checked in alright and to let me know he was there if we needed anything. He also offered New Years suggestions. Tom and his wife are amazing. There is no doubt we will rent this home again and there is no doubt we will refer as many people as we can to this rental.  You definitely can't go wrong with this property.
Tom is incredibly professional and an outstanding host. He responds quickly to messages and is clear with his check in instructions. 5 stars!
Central location, ample parking, nice view of the lake.
Beautiful view. Description is 100% accurate. Only downfall is paying for laundry. Located in a great area and close to shops and food places. Tom is also fast a responding to any questions.
Excellent property!  Nice view, all of the amenities, and very quick communication.
great stay tom went out of his way to help up hightly recomended

Great location, central to many destinations. The home is two separate units, which I didn’t realize.  Tom is very responsive and worked with us on a later check out when our shark excursion was rescheduled. We loved the area and Hawaii. This was our first visit.
Tom was very friendly and responded to my last minute request to rent his home. We had a lovely stay.
Great neighborhood/ location. Apartment could be cleaner but overall we had a good stay.

Tom is easy to communicate with and polite, nice location. Sound definitely an issue if the bottom apartment is occupied. Feels like you are sharing same space with the other tenants because you can hear everything from the bottom apartment since it only has a glass door for separation.  Not fit for bottom and top portion rental, needs cleanliness.
My family checked in but soon realized that we did not book accordingly to accommodate everyone in our group. Tom was very helpful and quick to help us get the accommodations we needed.

The house is off the beaten path, which is perfect for those wanting to “live like the locals.” While the kitchen is small, it’s just enough for quick meals before hitting the road for tours or heading to the best beach in the world. The house is clean, the beds are comfortable, and air conditioning in the bedrooms and main living area were a welcome relief to the afternoon heat. We highly recommend this house for anyone staying on the windward side of the island.
Awesome place and easy to communicate with!

Great location. The house is in a quiet neighborhood and still close enough to many destinations and shopping areas. Air conditioning in the bedrooms and kitchen provided relief in the afternoon heat and warm evenings. Kitchen is small, just enough for small meals. If bottom unit is occupied, you can hear everything especially in the kitchen, which is located downstairs. Tom is professional, easy to communicate, and quick to respond.
Great location. Tom is really responsive. We had a great time.
X
Tom was very helpful and quick to respond. We had a minor issue with the Wifi and he promptly fixed it. Would for sure stay again

Loved our stay at Tom's for our first Airbnb experience. Beautiful, safe area and close to town. Also very roomy for the 4 of us. Easy check in and out(his directions were clear). So grateful for his prompt response to any questions we had and it was so nice to meet him in person on our last day. Beach towels and toys (ie. paddle boards/snorkel equipment) would have been great but basics were provided. We had no issue with (Website hidden by Airbnb) stated on other comments, but the other part of the duplex was not occupied during our stay. We will definitely consider booking there again. Thank you Tom!!!

Top Lage 
Superschnelle Antworten von Tom
We had a Great stay here. Tom responded very quickly to any questions I had. Beautiful house with a Great view !

The kitchenette is downstairs with no place to eat so food must be brought upstairs. 
The place is fairly modern , laminate floors good beds. Couches are somewhat  uncomfortable. Nice view of the lake, modern washer and dryer.
Nice view

Tom was extremely quick to respond to any and all concerns that came up throughout our stay. The location is beautiful and the place was good for what we needed. Only negative I wanted to mention is that there isn't a hot tub like it says in the description. Otherwise the other reviews and description are very accurate! Would stay here again!

house_rules: Have fun and be yourself. In Hawaii we are one family one ohana. Smile be happy. Smoke outside on the patio. Check out 12 pm Check in 6:30 am 12:30 pm or 6:30 pm only  If early or late request based on other guest as we need to respect our fellow guest ....we can always store luggage and set up for beach chairs beach tents umbrellas and even hammocks ....town transport to restaurants spas and movies We ask if you bring in beach sand please help us to remove asap as it damages hardwood flooring it also gets everywhere please respect and consider aina our ohana  We have a lot of items for guest to use complimentary surfboards snorkel gear beach equipment all these things are complimentary and are for everyone's enjoyment please do not take them home with you and please replace it if damaged or lost please inform us if anything happens  This is not a party environment people in the building are quiet and private there are places to party ie bars and clubs even arcades outside .....we ask

reviews.comments:
We had a great time at Jon's place. It is very close to the beach. Jon welcomed us personally and showed us the apartment and the amenities. He also provided us with surfboards, beach chairs, beach towels, complementary water and a bottle of wine to get the party started. The studio was very clean and comfortable. The bed is huge and amazingly comfortable. 
In short, a great place to stay when visiting Waikiki area. 
Jon went out of his way to provide us with great service, a smile and kind conversation:-)

We meet a very good host,pepared and considered everything for us.checking in and out is free.The room is  very good convinent for a vacation in Honolulu,shopping,relaxing,driving,sightseeing...we  stayed here just like ourown home.easygoing and warmhearted host.We had great days in here.Next time  I will be here again.

Had a amazing stay in Jons studio. There was 4 of us. Nice new kitchen. Jon provided us with water, fruit, towels, surf boards, beach umbrellas,  coolers, snorkeling gear. Gave us free surf lessons, drove us to the beach and set everything up for us for free. Suggested many restaurants and new places and beaches. Suggested a beach that only the locals know about and it was absolutely  amazing!! The beach is so beautiful. Ask Jon about the beach! You won't regret going there!! Jon is very nice and always made sure we have everything we needed. Helped us get a jeep for 9.99$ a day. Overall a very pleasant stay!Thank you Jon. Mahalo

We just finished the perfect trip to Hawaii with Jon as our host. We were first time airbnb users and were a little skeptical of airbnb vs our traditional hotel and resort. We usually stay in 5 star resorts like Hyatt Regency. Jon responded immediately after our initial inquiry. This is our also our first trip to Hawaii and we needed help with planning and activity suggestions. Jon offered a list of things to do and places to eat. Jon also offered to pick us up from the airport to save on taxi fees. He personally picked us up and handed us the keys and showed us the apartment. The apartment was perfect with everything we needed. Snorkel gear surfboards pots pans dishes glasses kitchen condiments. It is very charming yet simple and very clean. It is warm and cozy. We had Fresh towel service, daily room makeWe just finished the perfect trip to Hawaii with Jon as our host. We were first time airbnb users and were a little skeptical of airbnb vs our traditional hotel and resort. We usually stay in 5 star resorts like Hyatt Regency. Jon responded immediately after our initial inquiry. This is our also our first trip to Hawaii and we needed help with planning and activity suggestions. Jon offered a list of things to do and places to eat. Jon also offered to pick us up from the airport to save on taxi fees. He personally picked us up and handed us the keys and showed us the apartment. The apartment was perfect with everything we needed. It is very clean yet simple and charming. It is warm and cozy. We were offered fresh towel service, daily room make up, clean linens, bottled water and even a welcome bottle of desert wine with Hawaiian cookies. Jon provided island fruits complimentary for us. It was perfect after a long flight. It is in a perfect area close to the beach and restaurants. We walked to the beach everyday and learned to surf with Jon free. Jon also helped us rent a car for 2 days to explore the north and east shores of the island. He found a special for 9.99 per day at enterprise. We were given free parking in the building which was perfect after a day exploring and adventures. Jon knows the island very well and directed us to the best restaurants and activities. We walked to the food pantry bought some light groceries. Breakfast: Eggs fresh baked bread bacon and fresh oj to make perfect breakfasts in bed better than any room service at a fraction of the cost. Lunch sandwiches. We also walked to Aloha kitchen for some lobster eggs benedict. Amazing and under 15 dollars. We also saved money because most of the activities suggested were free or very inexpensive. Another recommendation from jon and walking distance from the apartment is a 24 diner called Wailana Coffee House featured in Hawaii 5.0. We experienced the island as if...
Great location, and Jon is super helpful! It Was an excellent stay! Mahalo, Jon
Comfortable, affordable,  and convenient apartment close to beach, Waikiki, and the Ala Moana shopping center that allows guests to maximize their Oahu experience and not drain their budget.

Upon arrival I felt at home, Jon made arrangements for a taxi to pick me up at the airport and bring me to the apt.  The space was nice and clean and welcoming, the location...Amazing. Jon told me about all the shops, restaurants and beach's I should go to that were all in walking distance.  Jon picked me up to go surfing and we got a chance to chat about Hawaii life! I rented a moped while I was there and was able to park it right outside the apartment, in my opinion this is the best way to explore Waikiki without having to worry about parking or taking cabs.  At the end of my stay Jon was kind enough to give me a lift back to the airport.  I do plan on visiting Hawaii again and definitely look forward to renting from Jon again.

Our flight arrived late (9:00 PM) and Jon was very accommodating meeting us for check in and helping us find a late night place to eat.  The unit was clean and comfortable.  Jon gave my 11 year old daughter surf lessons the next day at Waikiki (waking distance) and helped us make the best of what was a short stay in Honolulu.

Jon's studio was wonderful. Just as described. We had the studio, bathroom,  and kitchen all to ourselves and Jon was very friendly and helpful via messages. Large cozy bed and a TV with HBO go and apple TV. Would definitely stay there again.

I cannot say enough good things to say about our experience at Jon's Airbnb! He was so very welcoming, offered to pick us up from the airport at a discounted rate (Taxi's and users in Hawaii are very expensive). We arrived earlier than check in but Jon allowed us to lock up our luggage for the day prior to check-in so that we could start enjoying our time on the island. He immediately offered to take and teach my brother and I surfing which I believe is above and beyond. He had awesome recommendations of places to eat and things to do. He helped us even plan a very fun trip to the North Shore (included beach plans and other fun stops - Dole plantation farm, shopping, ect.). Overall everything was excellent, and we would definitely come back. The location is also great, a 2 minute walk from an ABC store, restaurants and the beach. Offered many extra accessories such as surf boards, snorkel gear, beach chairs, bottled water and much more. Will definitely be back, thanks again Jon!

Jon's place was the best. Great location and everything and more my girlfriend and I needed. As for Jon. You won't get better hospitality and service than him. So helpful with anything we needed. Surf boards, snorkels, pick up from airport, places to eat, the lot.  Thank you so much for making our trip to Hawaii amazing. When we come back we will be staying here.

My daughter and I spent 5 nights at Jons Chateau Waikiki and we had a really lovely time. Jon was a really accommodating host who went out of his way to take us for a surf and help my daughter catch a few waves!! He also shuttled us about one morning for a hike, breakfast and surfing at Waikiki. The studio apartment was clean, comfortable (the bed was fantastic!) and had everything we needed and was really close walk to beach, Hilton lagoon and shops. Fantastic food at Wailana cafe around the corner at Jons suggestion...... Thanks so much Jon for looking after us! Hopefully we will come back to visit your next air BnB at Diamond Head one day and meet your daughter :) Mahalo!!
Jon was very accommodating . Place was very clean and comfortable for our short overnight stay

Jon's place was perfect for our short stay in Honolulu! The suite had everything you needed for your stay including air conditioning and dishes for cooking. He was an incredible server providing all sorts of recommendations and even a surf lesson. We definitely would stay with him again! Thanks for everything Jon.

We were very lucky to met Jon. He was a very helpful host and his place was located 5 minuets walk to the Hilton village lagoon where we spent most of our time.  Thank you Jon for having us and your hospitality.

Jon was a great host! He picked us up at the airport and dropped us off. He made sure we had everything we needed the entire stay. The place had water, fruit, a bottle of wine for us, towels, beach items, the list goes on. He even brought us surfing and it was amazing! My birthday  was over our trip and he ordered leis for my husband and I and had them waiting in the fridge for us. How thoughtful! Every day he recommended good restaurants for breakfast lunch dinner and even happy hour. The recommendations were always fabulous we never had anything bad, best food ever! Great first experience with Airbnb and hope to stay there again! Thanks Jon for everything we had an amazing time

Jon a été un superbe hôte, ils nous as donné plein de bon conseil pour notre séjour, ils nous as aider a planifier notre court séjour. Il a eu la générosité de venir nous reconduire gratuitement au port pour notre croisière. Je vous le recommande sans hésiter. Merci Jon
Jon was great, very prompt with responses, directions, etc.  Had everything we needed for our short stay and was extremely helpful!

Best host ever . Jon is extremely helpful . He picked up us from the cruise ship port. Recommend us for the good restaurant . He took us to snorkeling and teach us surfing . He even provided snorkeling and surfing gears . His place is walking distance to shopping mall,  bus stop and Hilton village , very handy location . The bed is huge and comfortable . I will definitely recommend Jon for your Honolulu stay

From the moment that I arrived at the location, Jon was very helpful. He assisted me with bringing my bags in and he made sure that I was comfortable and knowledgeable of where everything was and of how everything worked. It was just enough space for me. There was air conditioning, clean towels, a refrigerator, a microwave, and even a stove to cook food. Jon checked in on me daily and made sure that I was aware of where all of the local favorites were to eat, and to simply have a great time.

Jon's place was walking distance from EVERYTHING - the mall, the beach, and a host of restaurants. 

If I ever come back to Hawaii, I will be more than glad to stay at Jon's place again. It's so convenient and you do not feel like you wasted money.

Thanks so much Jon.

Ashley
Awesome host nice place to spend the night very accommodating

Jon was very welcoming and had done a great job in preparing for my visit. He ensured I had all relevant information prior to arriving and personally met with me to ensure I was happily squared away when I checked-in. The room was very clean and updated. Spacious with a nice kitchen and decently sized bathroom. Jon was even generous enough to spend some time with me to show all the good places to eat and explore near Waikiki. If you have time, Jon is also willing to provide some surf lessons and allow you to borrow some beach gear with Waikiki Beach less than a 5 min walk away.

My wife and I traveled to Hawaii for the first time last week. Although our destination was the Big Island, we had to spend a night in Honolulu. Given that all hotels were in excess of $300 a night and we just needed to kill about 18 hours in Honolulu, we thought of giving Airbnb a shot for the first time. 

This is when we came across Jon's listing. From the very beginning, Jon was incredibly friendly and courteous even before we departed Toronto. He would constantly stay in touch always keen to be of assistance in any way. He was nice enough to advise us that a cab from the airport to his place would cost $55 one way. He offered to pick us up at a one way cost of $29! Just as promised, he did exactly that, was already at the airport when we landed. Jon is an incredibly well rounded guy. Based on his vast travel experiences and professional background, we struck up a great rapport and friendship over some great conversation on the drive home. 

Jon's place is located in the heart of downtown Honolulu, a walking distance from all the hot spots. This worked out very well for us given that we only had about 6 hours the following morning to explore the city before our flight to the Big Island. The unit itself is extremely clean and comfortable. Although not requested or required, Jon ensured he had kept beach towels/chairs, snorkeling gear, toiletries, sun screen and some snacks/water for us should we decide to explore the beach. The bed was very comfortable and the studio apartment also has a kitchen and large bathroom. We were very comfortable in Jon's unit and encourage you to give Jon an opportunity to be your host. 

The best part of our short stay in Honolulu is the 'value add' Jon provides. When we arrived at his place around 10pm, he stayed back and assisted us plan our morning and afternoon in Honolulu with the aim of being able to see the most we can in our limited time. At 7am, he gave us an hour of his time and drove us around some really neat spots: Waikiki Beach areas, shopping district, Magic Island and then dropped us to Diamond Head where we did the Hike to the top. He suggested a great place for breakfast (Aloha Kitchen) where we had a lovely breakfast after the hike. At 2pm, he arranged for a ride to the airport for us at the same rate of $29. 

I only wish we had more time with Jon. A person who truly embodies the culture of Hawaii: generosity, kindness and always giving with a smile. Jon is your gateway to Honolulu having lived there for ages! We could not have asked for a better first Honolulu and Airbnb experience. We made a great friend in Jon, and will always remain in touch and be back to see him and his family soon!

Jon was an amazing host. He came to greet us upon arrival, and provided tons of great recommendations on restaurants, things to do. The place is as described, in a sweet location and totally set up for adventures in Oahu! Jon graciously took my husband for a great surf session. We enjoyed snorkeling in places recommended by him-tons of gear is provided for guest use. Truly amazing! We highly recommend staying with Jon on a trip to Oahu.
Everything was great, superb location, very close to everywhere and perfect communication! 100%

Jon's place was perfect for what we needed- a 1 night stay in Waikiki. He had towels, snorkel gear, chairs, and a surfboard for us as well as umbrellas, parking available, etc. Had apple TV which was convenient. He was in constant contact and was always giving recs on places to eat, things to do, etc. Very accommodating and fit our needs.
When your hosts takes the effort to pick you up at the airport at a modest cost and arranges  the  way back....that is hopitality. Jon was very attentive and made every effort to make us comfortable.
We had a great time in Honolulu at Jon's place. He was very helpful and considerate. He gave us some wonderful recommendations too. We loved the Aloha kitchen. Thanks Jon!

We enjoyed our stay.  Jon was helpful in giving us advice on places to eat and places to visit.  The apartment met our needs for a comfortable bed and excellent location.  We felt welcome and had success reaching Jon by text.  He was very quick in his responses.

Jon is a super nice and considerate host. He gave us a lot of recommendations on what to see and what to eat in Honolulu. Jon's place is extremely convenient. It is close to the beach, tons of great restaurants, and scenic spots. We could use beach umbrella, chairs, towels, and snorkeling equipment provided in the room. Also, parking was free at Jon's.
He let us know the address and made a cheap taxi reservation for us. and said aloha infront of his house.

Wow! Incredible First-Time AirBNB Experience!

We were so nervous using AirBNB for the first time, we did not know what to expect. JON was THE REASON we went ahead and booked our first stay. Reading his reviews, person after person kept mentioning his hospitality in many different ways - and he definitely is THE MOST HOSPITABLE person I have ever met. Especially in over 15 years of my own vocation that is known for hospitality.

Days before we arrived we were in communication with Jon in setting up our arrival. We had o stay at a hotel for the first half of our trip that was for business, but when it was vacation time we hopped on over to Jon's place that was a short distance away. Jon came and picked our baggage up earlier in the day so we could wrap our meetings and be checked out of our hotel and not have to drag luggage all around. Even in our stay in our hotel, Jon was answering our questions about the area and giving GREAT advice.

Totally enjoyed Jon's place. It was a one room studio in an apartment complex that is only 3 stories tall. It was a quiet neighborhood and the main road was a 1 minute walk away. We walked everywhere in Downtown Waikiki and to the Ala Moana Mall. The beach and Hilton Lagoon was a 5 minute walk.

All the food recommendations were excellent in taste and easy on the budget. Real places from real locals. Jon helped us plan our trips to the North Shore and other famous spots. He provided everything we needed to have a great time without being charged extra - Beach Towels, Shade Umbrella, beach chairs, Inner tubes, Snorkel Gear. He offered to take us out surfing but we were just so darn busy seeing everything else.

Jon's place was great for our needs. We thought we were going to cook more, but just had snacks and breakfast we kept in the fridge. Jon surprised one day with fresh local fruit :-) Also, we are coffee addicts and wanted to brew our own even though local and national chain coffee shops were a short walk away so Jon went out of his way and brought over a coffee maker for us!!! We had to return the favor just a little bit, so we got him 2 Hawaiian mugs for the next guests ;-)

And oh I want to buy the same bed he has! That thing was HUGE and SO COMFORTABLE! My back thanks you!

The kindness and generosity were top notch. We hope to return to Ohau again, and if we do, we will definitely look up Jon's place for availability. Jon gus a real sense of Ohana.

Jon, Mahalo Nui Lao!
Everything was great.

Jon is the perfect host, gav us s many tips on where to eat, what to see, where to go shop, snorkel and more... even gave us surf board lessons! Thank you Jon for everything, your fantastic it was a pleasure meeting you! We will definitely book with you again when we are in Hawaii again!

Jon was a wonderful host.  He picked  us up when we arrived, and since we arrived before check-in, he took us to Diamond Head and took our bags to the room.  Everything was waiting for us when we arrived after a day of adventure.  We felt very secure and safe in our room, which is located near everything we wanted to do.  This is a prime location nestled in a quaint neighborhood surrounded by big hotels and condos.  It is near the bus stop, Uber drivers and transport services can easily find you and you can easily grab a taxi if that is your need.  I highly recommend this location to anyone who plans on exploring Waikiki Beach and nearby attractions.  The room is clean, the bed is comfortable and the water pressure in the bathroom is great.  You will have wifi and internet TV if you decide to nestle in for the evening. There is easy access to a food mart if you want to make your own food, or Jon will give you great advise on where to eat.  There were scuba masks, floats, coolers, beach towels and an umbrella available for a day on the beach.  Our expectations were exceeded with this great find for fun in Hawaii.
Jon was super friendly & responsive. Had great suggestions. We were here for 2 nights and would happily stay again. Thanks very much for your hospitality.

We had a great time staying at the apartment! Jon was a wonderful host, very helpful. 
The location was fantastic close to the beach and the mall.

Jon was very welcoming.  He was friendly and picked me up at the airport for a discounted rate.  He was quick with recommendations for eating places, though they were out of walking distance at times.  The place he dropped me for lunch was amazing.  The unit was clean and the bed was comfy and he included bottled water in the fridge which was an added bonus.  I do wish he'd told me it was there when I arrived and not several hours later after I'd already hit the beach and bought myself a waterbottle at the shop down the street though.

We had a really short stay in Hawaii and at Jon's place, only 12hrs ! But all we have to say is that Jon was really helpful and so welcoming ! The appartment was perfect, clean and the bed so confy after a big day of travelling ! He had good advice to give us about the island and we definitly going to contact him on our next (longer) trip to Hawaii ! Mahalo !

Jon was an excellent host! He went out of his way to make us feel welcome, and even brought over treats for us. He provided great suggestions on places to eat and things to do. We would definitely stay here again.

Our experience in oahu couldn't have been any more enjoyable than what we could have asked for. Jon was an amazing host and I can't even start to tell you how grateful we are that we got to meet him. He was like family making sure we were having a good time throughout the whole trip. Giving us suggestions of things that we could do. We mentioned to him that we were trying to keep a low budget on our trip and he kept that in mind the whole time. Take his suggestions they are great and delicious. Even to the last day he made sure we made it to airport and breakfast place okay. Thank you Jon for an amazing and unforgettable experience. You are very kind and warm hearted. Can't wait to come back when we have our little ones!
Our host was incredibly welcoming and open.  He made us feel very welcome and he was invested in the quality of our trip.  I feel that he always went the extra mile.

It was an amazing, incredible, wow experience.....We don't know how to explain....there are no words.  Jon and his family are AMAZING!   They assisted us in telling us about the island and where to travel and also great restaurants to eat.  We were also taught how to surf....which was amazing!   Hard but amazing!  We went for my birthday and he was so sweet and brought us a piece of cake from his favorite bakery with candles so we could have a little piece of cake on my birthday and make a wish!   He also got me and a beautiful Lei.   Jason and I would recommend this place to everyone we can.  Wow there really is no words to explain the family...ohana....that we felt.....I have never felt more love and welcomed than we did while we were in Hawaii. It was an awesome birthday and what a vacation!  We can't wait to come back.  Thank u so much!  And when our flight was delayed many many hours he still didn't mind picking us up from the airport and swinging us by somewhere to get food cause we were (Website hidden by Airbnb) hotel would ever do that for you.

The place we stayed at was close to many areas that we could walk to and enjoy eating and shopping. Though we stayed one night, I would gladly stay there longer next time. Jon was a great host and I highly recommend staying at his place cause he takes care of you.

Jon was an incredible host. He did everything to make our short stay more comfortable and easy. The room was in a great location, walking distance to practically anything we wanted. Jon really went out of his way to ensure we experienced Waikiki as fully as possible. Thanks again Jon, see you some other time!

We enjoyed a perfect short stay in Jon's apartment.  He went over the top to ensure anything during our trip was perfect, checking in on us with suggestions and ideas.   Room is in a great location and easy access.  Mahalo...
A very accomodating host! Thank you Jon! We had a great time even for a short stay in you place... Cheers!

Jon's place was absolutely perfect!!! He was a fabulous host, made suggestions on where to eat & what to visit, he acted more like a travel agent & we completely appreciated it!! If big city living with everything at your fingertips is what you're looking for, this is the perfect place for you!!! Thank you Jon for being so very helpful & being a 'superhost'!!!!
Economico. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo e jon e' davvero gentilissimo

Jon was a fabulous host. His communication was A+ and he made you feel very welcome and important even though he is a super busy guy! His attention to detail was great, and although the space wasn't super modern or fancy it was clean and comfortable and perfect for what we needed. Something to note for this property is the shared bathroom, which we were unaware of, not a major issue but prior warning would've been helpful. 
We loved our stay in Jon's place and appreciate all his assistance and ideas throughout our stay!

Jon's apartment is in a great location and is very comfortable. The best part is how lovely Jon is - he picked us up and dropped us off at the airport, gave us lots of advice on places to see and eat, texted each day to see if we needed anything, and took us surfing, hiking and snorkelling. The only downside is that the apartment shares a bathroom with another of Jon's apartments, but this is a minor inconvenience and is secure with various locks. We would definitely stay there again!

Jon, is as sweet as they come. Completely goes out of his way to help u. Takes u around. Suggest Restaurants. Can pick u up and deliver u to the airport. Gives u everything in your private studio. For the beach
 In the apt. Shampoo, peroxide (needed it for a boo boo) something 4 your sunburn. He's an awesome guy.

I stayed for 2 days in his studio with my wife. It was very clean and good location. But above all things he treated us like a family. I could have fantastic memories with him..
if you go to Honolulu visit him.

Fantastic communication from the host. Easy pick up and drop off from the airport. The place was clean and comfortable. Was under the impression that it was a room in the owners condo but it's a room with a shared bathroom in motel style older accommodation. Great value overall but there was some dodgy characters on the street at night and i wouldn't want to walk alone in this area after dark.

I was very happy with my stay at Jon's place.  Jon was extremely friendly and provided helpful recommendations for things to do and local restaurants.  The place was clean, full of amenities, has a shared bathroom, and conveniently located.

Jon was a most thoughtful host. He kept in touch with us to make sure all was well and also to give advice on local activities. He collected and dropped us off at the airport and was very keen to offer the best experience possible in Oahu.

We had such a wonderful time staying at Jon's apartment in Honolulu! The place was stocked with everything we'd ever need for the beach - chairs, umbrellas, snorkeling gear, a cooler, etc. Jon generously came to sweep and take out the trash every day, and he was always available via text to answer our questions and provide us with recommendations of places to eat and see. I think the best part of our stay was the morning Jon took us snorkeling and gave us a surfing lesson! He is absolutely so wonderful and sweet, and he truly exemplifies the kind spirit of Hawaii. He has several units in Honolulu and around Oahu (which I think is why some reviews mention having a shared bathroom - ours was private), and it is clear how much energy and effort he puts into making his guests feel welcomed and cared for! We would book with Jon again in a heartbeat.

the property was central to everything however the photos are generic of the attractions and should not be considered views from the apartment, as we assumed. In saying this Jon is a fanatic host and the 
unit was functional for the short stay. I recommend Jon as a host. Thanks for letting us stay
Jon made us feel welcome and is very helpful. He provided us transportation to the airport for a reasonable fee. The unit is in a quieter area of Waikiki and near a great Indian Restaurant.

Jon prepared everything we might need in the flat. Surfboard, beach towel, snorkeling mask, etc. The location was great. 5-10minutes walk to shopping centers and beach. Free parking just downstairs. We feel very good staying here!

房间里有各种各样的游泳潜水冲浪装备｡厕所是和另外一间的房客共用的,但还是很方便的｡有一个厨房,还有餐桌｡床很大很舒服,房间里的空调有躁音,睡眠比较轻的话,建议睡前关掉｡
房子距离购物天堂Ala Moana Center非常近,走路五分钟就到｡距离威基基海滩稍远,需要20分钟｡
房东非常热情,介绍了很多周围的餐馆和热门活动｡还很贴心地提供了免费的矿泉水以及洗发水护发素｡
我们住了两个晚上,周围很安静,待角有一家24小时的便利店和麦当劳,很方便｡
Jon was an excellent host and gave us great tips on what to do. Highly recommend
Jon was easy to reach and provided us with plenty of recommendations. The additional beach gear was very helpful and a cost saver.

Das Studio war sehr sauber und komplett ausgerüstet. Wir wurden sehr freundlich empfangen und Jon gab viele gute Tipps, z.B. wo die Einheimischen einkaufen und baden gehen. Alles nötige für den Strandbesuch war im Studio vorhanden. Das Studio war für uns in einer idealen Lage, ca. 10 Minuten zum Strand, 5 Minuten zum Einkaufen und Restaurants. Jon war 24 Stunden per SMS erreichbar. Der Transfer vom und zum Flughafen klappte perfekt. 
Nochmals besten Dank an Jon

If you're looking for a place just to crash, this is a place for you. About a 15-20 minute walk to Waikiki beach, shopping and restaurants. The parking is slightly confusing so make sure you really read and pay attention. The room reminded me of a college dorm, a bed with a TV  (Netflix was nice at night while winding down), and a small kitchen. The kitchen is a little out of date, as well as the bathroom. Our suitemates locked us out a few times all night, but Jon took care of that.  Jon was a great host and gave us a lot of great suggestions for places to eat and drink, and things to do. He also provided a free surf lesson, which was a lot of fun. Jon was very attentive, friendly and communicated frequently  (if needed).

We loved the convenient location.  There were several restaurants near-by and a five minute walk to the beach.  We found a Thai restaurant with in blocks where you could eat outside and it was reasonably priced.  It was nice to have a full kitchen where we could fix breakfast.  Jon was helpful in so many ways.  He was friendly and a good communicator.  He helped out by giving me a ride to the airport.  Jon is professional Uber driver.  Jon offered to help organize all sorts of activities including surfing lessons.  Parking was safe and secure at no additional cost.  We loved the comfortable king size bed.  The place was very clean.

Jon was extremely accommodating! His apartment was perfect for us. It was central to everything you need! Jon drove us out to Diamond Head for the markets when he picked us up from the airport, he gave us so many food suggestions! 
I highly recommend Jon if youre looking for someone who is very helpful and willing to go out of their way to give you some GREAT holiday tips! Mahalo Jon :)

Jon was a great and considerate host. Picked us up and drive us back to the airport.  Gave us a driving tour of the area. Gave us plenty of towels and beach gear. Even gave us a Toddler bathtub and baby shampoo for our little girl's bath time. The location was close to Waikiki Beach and walking distant from everywhere we wanted to go so we did not even get a rental car. The place was tidy with a decent kitchen. The shared bathroom was a non-issue. We appreciated the AC unit. Thanks for letting us rent out the unit.

Jon had numerous suggestions for places to eat, things to do and places to go, some according to where we were going or wanted to do.  He had water/beach equipment available for use.  He was quick to respond to messages and checked in with us mid-trip to see if we needed anything.

ﾋﾙﾄﾝでの学会参加のために利用しましたが､ﾋﾙﾄﾝだけでなくﾋﾞｰﾁやｺﾝﾋﾞﾆ､ﾚｽﾄﾗﾝ､ﾄﾛﾘｰの停留所などからも近く､非常に便利でした｡ﾍﾞｯﾄﾞ､冷房､ｷｯﾁﾝなどの設備もよく､ﾀｵﾙや飲料水も十分に供給され､これでﾋﾙﾄﾝの半額以下なのは､正に｢当たり｣という感じでした｡
難点としては､ﾄｲﾚとｼｬﾜｰが隣室と共有なこと｡相手がｼｬﾜｰを使っている間､ずっとﾄｲﾚが使えないのがちょっと困りました｡また使用時には相手の部屋から入れないように鍵を掛けるのですが､終了時に鍵を開けるのを忘れると､ずっと入れないことになります｡今回は3回も相手に閉め出されました(そのたびにﾅｲﾌでこじ開ける必要がありました)｡このあたりは隣人がどんな人になるかという運次第なのでしょう｡
ｵｰﾅｰのｼﾞｮﾝさんは大変いい方で､｢朝食ならこのﾚｽﾄﾗﾝがお勧め｣｢今日は花火があるよ｣など､こまめに情報をくださいました｡空港送迎も行ってくれます(片道29ﾄﾞﾙ)｡なおﾁｪｯｸｲﾝの時間に関して説明文に何種類かの異なる記述がありますが､事前に相談すれば柔軟に対応してくださいます(今回は部屋が空いていたので午前中に入ることができました)｡

Jon is the best host ever. Location fantastic. Our only issue was the shared bath because we didn't know. It didn't say that in the ad. The way it's set up is worse than a shared bath down the hall - it was an adjoining bath. The bath had 4 locks, so we kept our bathroom door locked on our bedroom side until we wanted to go in, then we went in and locked the bathroom from the inside on the door to the other guest's room. We forgot to unlock that one once, so the other guest couldn't get into the bathroom. They had to knock on the shared wall to get our attention so we could unlock it. Luckily we were there! The only reason I didn't lower the star rating down from 5 is because Jon, our host, really is exceptional. His advice and attention would offset any inconvenience there might be. He was always available by text, gave great restaurant and activity suggestions, even got in the car with us to show us around the immediate neighborhood.

Jon was very accommodating, he even brought me the keys when the Honolulu marathon route confused me!  He had great suggestions for activities and restaurants, and provided towels and snorkeling gear!

Just finished the perfect Hawaii vacation at Jon's Airbnb.  It's a basic but very functional apartment, a TERRIFIC value for the money, especially if you plan on being active in Hawaii (why else would you be there) and don't need luxury accommodation since you won't be there much!  The nicest perks:  the apartmnet is fully equipped with beach gear, water shoes, boogie board, coolers.  I felt like a local!  I couldn't believe how close I was to a REAL SURFING BEACH... Jon can get you a surfboard or even offer a lesson or arrange a side trip to Diamond Head for a very reasonable fee.  But if you have your own board just carry it five mintues down the street and jump in the surf!  It's hard to believe a reasonably priced place like this exists so close to perfect surfing.  

It's true that you have a shared bathroom, but for me it was no big deal.  There's a bolt on both access doors;  you bolt your door from the inside and the other guest is locked out while you're there.  Nobody really uses the bathroom for more than 5 minutes (10 if you're showering) so it is a minor inconvenience given all the other amenities.  I never felt unsafe or worried with the shared bathroom, and it stayed clean the entire time, and I never even saw the other guest on the other side of the door.

The neighborhood is a quiet local area surrounded by mega hotels like Hilton Illikai and shopping like Bloomingdales and macy's, so you really have it all and can walk EVERYWHERE you need:  groceries, restaurants, shopping, beach.  I felt safe and welcome in this secret neighborhood.  People are friendly but respect your privacy and it was a perfect stay for my short getaway.  

Best of all is JON.  Make no mistake, he is a king among hosts (and coming from a Superhost like me, that's a rare compliment).  Jon will take care of all your needs, he's genuinely interested in people and wants you to enjoy Hawaii.  He can pick you up and drop you at the airport for a VERY reasonable charge, tell you where to go and what to do, arrange anything.  It's like having a private tour guide that comes with the apartment.  I''m going to make all my layovers stop in Hawaii and stay at Jon's apartment every time :)
perfect!! Jon very very kind!!
Really a great stay in Waikiki! Jon gave us some wonderful suggestions and we had a really fun time!

Jon a été un hôte formidable! Toujours disponible pour répondre à nos questions. Il a prit 45 minutes au début de notre séjour pour nous faire visiter les incontournables dans les environ de Honolulu et nous suggérer des activités et des restaurants.

Jon's place was very quaint and close to everything! There is a shared bathroom but it was completely fine and we never even saw the other guests and all the doors lock on both sides. The unit was quiet and easily accessible by the bus or you can just walk everywhere, which is what we did. What really shone for us though was Jon himself. He truly loves where he lives and goes above and beyond for his guests. He's kind and accommodating and has such knowledge about the island! He kept in touch our whole trip via text giving us restaurant recommendations, the best snorkel spot and even drove us to diamond head as a courtesy. He picked us up and dropped us off at the airport too, and that was so convenient. Much cheaper than a cab! Can't say enough wonderful things about Jon and our experience, 11 out of 10- will be back as soon as we can.

Jon is such a great host, so helpful and accommodating.  He picked us up at the airport and dropped us off the following morning to check in bags and then drove us to Pearl Harbour.  Excellent service.  We were only there for one night and and a day but we packed in a lot thanks to Jon's suggestions.

Jon was very friendly and helpful, suggesting lots of places to visit and places to eat. He was available 24/7, even at 4am when we received notification that our flight had been delayed by four hours. We were able to let him know that we no longer required an early lift to the airport.
I didn’t realise when I booked the apartment several months earlier that there is a shared bathroom. As mentioned in a previous review the bathroom is between two apartments. When using it you lock the door to the other apartment but you have to remember to unlock the door again when you have finished. The occupants of the other apartment forgot to do this one time, leading to a moment of panic when I thought they weren’t home.
Overall it was a very convenient location for a two night stay and Jon did his utmost to ensure we had a great stay.

Jon is extremely helpful and responsive to requests or needs. 
 This place is great for young folks who want to enjoy the water --full of water toys, close to the ocean and reasonably priced.
  Not as well suited for women of a certain age traveling alone--shared bathroom can be a problem; steep steps also can be a problem ( though Jon very graciously carried my bags upstairs) he was not around when I had to leave.
  The area is between big buildings and the street is noisy although the good news is that it is quite well situated.

It was our second time in Waikiki and this location is way better than previous one that was close to the zoo. 
We've been using Airbnb for almost 6 years and by far Jon is one of the top 3 hosts we've met. He was always there for us wehn we needed anything. He even took us to secret snorkeling spot and gave a surfing lesson for my 7 year old son.
IF I'll go to Oahu again I'll be definately trying to stay at Jon's place!
No was extremely helpful with planning our time on Oahu.  He checked in daily to ensure we had every thing we needed.  He was a great host.

The unit is nice, clean and very conveniently located at walking distance from the beaches, shops and restaurants. Most importantly Jon was one of the most helpful and amazing host we have ever met: he helped us in every possible ways: giving us a ride back and forth from the airport, keeping our huge bags before we could check in and after we had checked-out in order for us to make the most of our time in Honolulu without having to carry all our stuffs (this was priceless!), and last but not least Jon gave us many many good advices about all the happenings and great places to go and experience in Honolulu! He went above and beyond for us and we feel very grateful. We definitely recommend this place if you want to discover Honolulu!

This was our first experience with Airbnb and I'm not sure anything will beat it!  
Jon is an amazing host and so knowledgable about all the happenings and great places to go and experience !   
From an extra day of free parking to getting us a sweet deal on a 1 Hour sail boat ride! 
He went above and beyond for us!  
Super clean room and perfect for our needs! 
Thanks Jon
Jon was a great host! He kept us well informed on activities, and cut us some great deals, and worked with our time constraints to make sure we were well cared for and our time well spent.
Great location clean and quiet.  John was very helpful with suggestions for restaurants and Uber service to historic sights.

The studio apartment was in a convenient location. Although we were there only one night Jon was an excellent host. Gave us some good restaurant recommendations and went out of his way to collect us and drop us to the place. 5 star for Jon. I did not know however that it was a shared bathroom. I did not see this advertised anywhere so this affected my rating.  The room was clean. Being a Saturday night it was pretty noisy outside, and the blinds did not stop all the light getting into the room. There was a few lights from across the street shining in on our bed, which made it a terrible nights sleep.

Jay was super nice and had a lot of great recommandations for food and shopping. The place is simple and comfortable (large bed, AppleTV, kitchen). It shares a bathroom with another unit, and you can lock everything easily. Thanks Jay!

To All, This isn't the Castle or Trump tower, but its clean, safe, central to all close to ares fringes to beach, so for extra 2-3 blocks walking, ya get value- Jay has set unique  Standard to your welfare of Taxi-costs Ubber, the run-around hell take care-of at ridiculous low rate. we Went out exploring the western block cooridor, and its got Jazz, Rock, dancing venues, the area has upscaled what he has no power of, its friendly nto all as area is just outside beach, harbor, main downtown of Honolulu, Waikiki...The fountains of the canal, river areas all lead to yachts, harbor, swimming, surfing beaches....Again uniquely its Safe, nice, protected, but the scene is midly far ,the extra  2-3 blocks total of 6 blocks from hilton hotels and all... the kitchenette, refridge, and micro-satisfy cause resturants are the prize, of this , his many hosted, and store thats affodable, fresh, new well run, and if ya see down the streets, its traffic free, essentially so evening, walk, stroll a good experience, the bed was actually big king, and comfee' and if not rich this is a great find, as is your host, you call hes there or calls when, and guides or delivers (Website hidden by Airbnb) From Tiger, a fanatic, critic, its good.. the showers hot, tall, standup, and shared, but the doors lock, and its a system to sharing, no intrusion... ask for extra towels and ya got it made... Jon was very pleasant host and fast respond during and after arriving. The place is very clean and he also provided beach towels, snorkeling gears. He's also gave me recommendations of the nice restaurants in the area. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Jay is lovely really wants you to feel welcome, for us the shared bathroom will be something to look for in the comments, it didn't appeal to us (was in comments but no photos) and no towels was a real miss on our behalf (if written in the comments) for this property. I think the property needs new blinds also people can walk past and see straight into your room, I'm glad we only had 1 night here, was closer to the airport that's why we chose it, however a smoker had been in the room previously and you could smell it, all the added extras of snorkelling gear and surf board is great, car park a bonus, I want to write more positive however it was very basic and the tiny shared bathroom was just too much to look past and not write a review. Jay is an AMAZING host, and his condo was so convenient and a great place to stay! I had originally booked two nights, but unfortunately my flight to Honolulu was canceled and I didn't make it until the next day. Jay was super understanding and accommodating about the situation which was super appreciated, and he was extremely reachable and available by call and text. Jay also had great recommendations and connections for food and activities, and he even curated it to the fact that I only had one day for vacation before moving to a hotel for work. 

Jay actually has nine different properties that he rents out through Airbnb, so you may not have the exact location experience as I did. However, I had a private room and bathroom while I was there, and was in a brand new (1.5 year old condo), so while I was expecting an entire apartment to myself with a shared bath, the set-up worked for me. There is a shared common space and kitchen, and a nice mom-daughter duo was in the other room in the condo. Jay had plenty of supplies - beach chair, umbrella, towels, snorkel equipment, etc. which made it so simple to get to the beach within minutes of checking in! 

The condo was also SUPER convenient to get around the area! A quick 5-10 minute walk gets you to Kahanamoku Beach and the Hilton lagoon, a 15-20 minute walk to the Shirokiya Japanese Village, and a 10 minute walk to the Ala Moana mall. I don't think anywhere was more than a 25 minute walk from where I wanted to go. 

Highly recommend Jay and his Waikiki Airbnb properties! If I'm ever back in the area in the future, I will definitely stay again!
Jay was very helpful with suggestions of places to check out around Oahu.  Accommodating with giving us our own room and own bathroom.

We just finished the best experience with Jay's Airbnb. This family are just the best when it comes to hosting. I can't say enough good things about this stay. Jay is the epitome of what an Airbnb host should be. He did everything that was humanely in his power to ensure my short stay was perfect. Jay was a great host.  He hooked us up with beach gear and surf boards for the week making it much more fun and very affordable for Waikiki! We loved the view from the room. Great place for budget Waikiki experience! Thanks Jay:)

In short: Not recommended. Most weird and frustrating airbnb experience ever and felt scammed. Location and photos in listing did not match the place I stayed at. Host Jay seems friendly but does not understand customer service and was not at all helpful in resolving the multiple issues we had.

The details: I showed up at the address listed on the airbnb site (The Windsor Waikiki, a nice looking building) but it turned out that Jay had texted me a different address. When I called him he said something about the airbnb address being the old office and to go to the new location that he had texted me. I didn't think too much about it but in hindsight it was a little suspicious.

When we finally checked-in with the small office downstairs and went to the unit, we found that the place was small and rundown which I figured is what you pay for given its location in Waikiki. 

However our stay only got worse from there. The place was not clean even though my reservation was charging $50 in cleaning fees for a 2 night stay. Cabinets, trashcan, furniture etc. were old and rusty or generally run down. There was long hair on the ground from previous visitors/guests. The tabletops, bedframe, TV had dust or streaks over it and looked like it had not been cleaned for a while. There were 2 small bottles of water in the fridge and when we ran out the second day, I drank some water from the water filter also in the fridge and immediately spat it out because it was SOUR. When I opened the lid of the water filter I saw that it was moldy on the inside. At this point I'm pretty frustrated but figured I get what I pay for in Waikiki and was still somewhat willing to let it slide.

The 2nd night when we got back, we noticed that some things were different about the place - a light we didn't know how to turn off was now off and the balcony door was open though we had left it closed. I immediately messaged Jay about this and his reply was that he had come in to turn off the AC because a neighbor had complained about it dripping. I was beyond shocked that he would just come into a place we were staying in and not say anything before, during, or after the fact. I would've been more than happy to come back to turn off the AC if it was causing problems (which I was not made aware of).

In the same conversation I told Jay about the issues we had with lack of cleanliness and filtered water being sour and how frustrated I was but his response was that guests typically buy their own water so the water filter was not meant to be used, and that he would tell the cleaning people to do a better job "next time" - comments that don't help me at all. I found this to be completely poor customer service and lack of understanding from the guest perspective.

Thankfully we were only there for a short stay. Was able to work something out with the help of an amazing airbnb support rep but I feel like I have lost my previous confidence and trust in the airbnb experience.

To be fair, Jay was easy to reach through airbnb messaging and text and gave local suggestions for food and activities. But I would recommend only conversing through the airbnb app for the important stuff so that airbnb support can more readily help you if you find yourself in the same situation as me.
fantastic host, fabulous local tips
