house_rules: Please no shoes when you are in the apartment. the floors scuff easily and after all it is NYC.  Also, please take trash out when you leave and place towels on hooks to the left of the closet.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I love a good adventure.

reviews.comments: Amazing apartment! I had a great time and it was easy to deal with Molly. Thank you so much! Jean-Marie
Everything was great! Nice clean apartment, bedrooms were both a good size. Host was generous and offered us toiletries throughout the place, hope to stay there again
Amazing flat , excellent situation!! I recommend this place !!
Molly was very welcoming, accesible and flexible. She made our stay a pleasant experience.

Molly's place was clean and beautifully decorated. We had the apartment to ourselves for the three days we were in New York, and the whole experience was perfect. It's located within a quick walking distance of a 24-hour CVS, plenty of restaurants, a Metro Station, local markets and parks, and we always felt safe walking around together, even late at night. She's a very pleasant host and was quick to communicate with us whenever we had questions during our stay. I would absolutely book here again! Thank you, Molly!
Great location. Everything was lovely and as described. Molly was a super accommodating and friendly host.
Really nice apartment. Easy communications with host. Great area. Value for money. Highly, highly recommended.
Amazing and quirky place. Excellent location and an amazing host.
The host canceled this reservation 29 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 13 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Molly's space was a lovely spot to visit in NY and was much better than expected. There were many places nearby to eat, shop and explore. Access to the subway was perfect. Could not have asked for better accommodations. Would definitely stay here again!

Great location! Plenty to do around the apartment. CVS/Walgreen nearby, bars, restaurants (check out Ippudo for ramen, or Ray’s for a 24h slice after a long night out!) and subway access. Check in was a breeze and Molly was very accommodating and available for questions the few times we messaged her. Also, the apartment is wonderfully decorated (pics don’t do it justice!). Highly recommend!
Perfect Place to Star in NYC!Many Young People!

Looking to adventure in New York City? This is a good home base.  Local to several culture experiences of NYC.  Molly’s space is very homey and decorated with vintage pieces and art. Would love to stay again for future trips I’ll be making to NYC.
You expect all what Molly offers at her place. Lovely clean apartment. Definitely coming back to it ❤️

Perfect location!! Lots of nice Japanese restaurants and bubble tea downstairs. Real room decorating is better than photos. Cozy and romantic little apartment. Molly is nice. Good place to live in east village(๑˙ｰ˙๑)

Molly’s place is wonderful! The apartment is cozy and comfortable, but oozes character and a great vibe. 
The location is fantastic for exploring different delicious cuisines, and quirky bars. 
Molly was quick to communicate and flexible with our check-in time. 
Molly’s place is an awesome base for exploring the lower east side, and NYC generally. Would highly recommend!

Definitely a must-stay place for ppl who want to enjoy the city in NY style. The neighborhood is great and close to metro. Molly is super lovely and always in contact. The place is gorgeous and laidback. Will come back again!

name: Alcam Colon 52 Apartment
summary: Spacious and bright apart., 30 meters from Ramblas and the sea front. Nice views, 2 bedrooms, 1 double and 1 with twin beds, living room with sofa bed, modern bathroom with shower flat walk. Free wifi central AC and heating.
description: Spacious and bright apart., 30 meters from Ramblas and the sea front. Nice views, 2 bedrooms, 1 double and 1 with twin beds, living room with sofa bed, modern bathroom with shower flat walk. Free wifi central AC and heating. The Gothic Quarter is the medieval centre of the city and a true labyrinth for the adventurer visitor. Walk the little streets around the Cathedral and discover the most antique dealers, or the feathers and umbrellas’ merchants in the mythic street Banys. It is been here where took place the most determining historical events of Barcelona along the centuries. To see : Chapel of Saint Agatha, Roman Wall, Jewish Quarter, Chapel of Saint Llúcia, The Cathedral , Pia Almoina, Frederic Marès Museum, The Royal Palace, The Chapel of Saint Agatha, Clariana-Padellàs House (Historic Museum of the city), Columns of the Temple of Augustus, Sant Jaume Square , Sant Felip Neri Square, Plaça del Pi.

reviews.comments: La verdad que el servicio por parte de alcam fue muy malo son groseros y nada hospitalarios, el departamento tiene una excelente ubicación y una vista de ensueño pero el edificio es muy viejo y se descompone el elevador con facilidad, el aire acondicionado no servia adecuadamente la estufa tampoco los sillones de la sala olían a orines y había una tabla en el departamento floja que reportamos y nunca arreglaron

name: Spacious room Kadıköy Yeldeğirmeni
summary: Wonderful apartment situated in the hearth of Yeldeğirmeni, Kadıköy. Access to all parts of the city due to its vicinity to the harbor metro & bus (10 min. by foot). House with 4 rooms, equiped kitchen, spacious living, large terrace and  cat :-)
description: Wonderful apartment situated in the hearth of Yeldeğirmeni, Kadıköy. Access to all parts of the city due to its vicinity to the harbor metro & bus (10 min. by foot). House with 4 rooms, equiped kitchen, spacious living, large terrace and  cat :-)

reviews.comments: Onur's place is spacious and in a great location in a cool neighbourhood full of interesting cafés. Communication was pretty straightforward, they have a friendly cat, it was quiet most of the time. Sometimes the house can get a bit smoky but this is Turkey so that's hard to avoid. The kitchen is well-equipped and bathroom is clean. The hosts are friendly and speak enough English for the occasional conversation, but they're also good at giving you some quiet space too. Great stay!

name: Sunny 1 or 2 BR apt in Boerum Hill
summary: Large, sunny apartment in a classic Brooklyn 3-story row house in historic and trendy Boerum Hill neighborhood known for its charming, brownstone buildings and tree-lined streets.
space: Large, sunny apartment in a classic Brooklyn 3-story row house in historic and trendy Boerum Hill neighborhood known for its charming, brownstone buildings and tree-lined streets. Centrally located and steps away from 12 major train lines and great restaurants, cafes, boutiques, shops, theaters, museums, parks.  One block away is the A,C train which is 10 minutes to downtown Manhattan (Soho, Nolita, Lower East Side, Chinatown, Meat-packing district). This 800sf, 1-bedroom, apartment encompasses the entire 2nd floor of the house and has a private entry.  (optional:  2nd bedroom available for additional $25/night, more info below). The 3rd floor apartment is occupied by your hosts (Judy, Alex and their mini dachshund Lulu) and the first floor retail space is occupied by a gift shop.   Charming original details maintained in this recently renovated  home with modern kitchen, bathroom, fixtures and Bosch appliances. host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
My husband (a West coast transplant) and I (East coast native) bought and renovated this 19th century row house in Brooklyn several years ago.  Since then we have been enjoying the unique vibe here.  
We are both passionate about design (I am also an architect), so we really enjoyed setting up the vacation rental and hope our guests enjoy it too!

reviews.comments:
Great apartment! Super clean, comfortable, and plenty of space. Very close to the A/C and only a short trip to Manhattan. Beautiful neighborhood full of restaurants, bars and coffee shops. 

Would recommend anyone to stay here!

My husband, son and I stayed in Judy's apartment for a week. We loved it! The location was brilliant and the apartment was stunning. A fantastic kitchen that we cooked in every night, a great dining area for friends to pop around and very spacious, clean and stylish furnishings. Judy was brilliant. A caring and energetic host always there to ask questions and check in if we needed anything. On arrival she greeted us with some food and even helped me to organise my little son when we had to leave. Would definitely stay again and hope to do so later in the year :) Many thanks again Judy!

My parents came for their first visit (in a decade) to New York, so I booked Judy's second-floor apartment, just down the block from my flat. They spent a long weekend (three nights) in this spacious airy apartment.  The accommodations are clean, comfortable, secure, and include a well-equipped modern kitchen.   Judy was very nice and welcoming, providing a supply of breakfast staples as well as great hints about neighborhood cafes and restaurants.  My mother - always apprehensive about parking - was especially pleased that there is lots of free on-street parking available in the surrounding neighborhood.  Judy was easy to correspond with in advance and to connect with the day they arrived - she's very responsive, and even let me preview the space to ensure it would be accessible for my older parents. I hope the apartment is available the next time they visit Brooklyn - which they are excited to do as a result of a very restful, comfortable weekend.

Excellent experience! Judy met me at the curb and even helped carry our bags upstairs. We mostly communicated via text, she always responded promptly so it was very useful. The apartment itself is incredibly convenient, near many subway lines, excellent restaurants, and various interesting sections of Brooklyn. It was lots of space for two people, with plenty of light and a comfortable bed. Recommended all around as classy and convenient NYC lodging.

I honestly loved staying at Judy's apartment. She and her husband was really helpful, they gave us tips on restaurant, yoga classes...  The apartment was really clean and pictures are representative of the place. New kitchen and new bathroom. 

The area was great as well, a lot of restaurant and ship close by. It was our first time staying in Brooklyn and we enjoyed it a lot.
We had a wonderful stay at Judy's and absolutely recommend her place!  It was beautiful, extremely clean and in a great location near shops and restaurants and the subway! We will be repeat visitors.

My husband and I, along with our one year old son, had a wonderful stay at this apartment. Judy was great and very responsive via email and text. The apartment itself was spacious and had lovely amenities. Looks just like the photos. The washer and dryer was a huge plus for us since we were traveling with a toddler. The location is fantastic too. I cannot say enough good things about this apartment and experience!

I booked Judy's apartment for 2 nights last week along with my adult son and his girlfriend.  Judy was extremely helpful and easy to deal with!  The apartment was very spacious and immaculate.  There were fresh cut flowers on the table and a few essentials in the kitchen: milk, cereal, coffee, tea bags, etc.  These nice little touches were very much appreciated!  We had a quick breakfast at the apartment and then were on our way and ready to explore.  There were also toiletries (shower gel/shampoo) in the bathroom for those (like my son! who do not bring their own!  Judy also had an extra bedroom just down the hall that I rented as well (for privacy).  The apartment is located in a very nice and charming area with lots of (inexpensive) restaurants nearby along with some cute shops.  You can walk down Atlantic Avenue or State to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park (which is quite lovely!).  It's about a 10 minute walk.  We were literally a 3 minute walk to the nearest subway heading into Manhattan, so that was a plus.  Staying in Brooklyn is the way to go if you like a less chaotic and quieter place to stay.  We will definitely be back!

This apartment was fantastic. It's a lovely, charming place, very bright. The kitchen and bathroom have both recently been fully renovated. The apartment was very clean. 

Judy was a great host. When we arrived, we found that she had left us a carton of organic milk, granola, and a package of Stumptown coffee. She gave us some good tips for local restaurants, and she let us store our luggage in the building for a little while after we checked out. 

The location is great. There are some good restaurants just around the corner on Atlantic, as well as a very good french bakery. Just a couple of blocks down Bond are two more very good restaurants, Building on Bond and Ruccola. The neighborhood is great to walk around. Smith St. is just a couple of blocks away with tons of shops, bars, restaurants. The Hoyt Schermerhorn metro is just a couple of blocks away, which can take you into the city on the A or C, or further into Brooklyn on the G. Other statios are a few minutes walk away. 

We would love to stay here again.

This is a fantastic apartment - great space, great location, great price - and Judy is a wonderful host.  She responded to all of my questions and concerns promptly, accommodated an early arrival and late check out, and even promptly took care of a small issue that occurred during our stay.  I would absolutely stay here again.

We came to visit family in Brooklyn. This was an amazing space to relax and the perfect location to get around everywhere! Judy was so nice and accommodating. Her little touches made us feel so welcome :) We would recommend this and plan on staying here in the future.

The apartment is superb: spacious, immaculate, furnished with impeccable taste, and renovated with excellent quality materials!!!!! We loved the open space full of light and the spaciousness to relax after a busy day .Judy added so many touches that made our stay remarkable: basics like juice, milk, coffee and granola; toiletries, laundry detergent, fresh flowers. Everything was very clean and there were cleaning products available for our use.  The washer and dryer were a big plus. We were not able to meet Judy since she was not in town  but all our communications and the arrival/departure arrangements were perfect. We liked the neighborhood: diverse, vibrant, close to Atlantic terminal/subway/buses and with nice grocery/dinner options. It was a wonderful way to enjoy Manhattan since it was an easy and short subway ride away. We had the best pizza in many years at Lucali's. We could not asked for anything else and we are extremely thankful to Judy.

Judy was a fantastic host and my family and I couldn't have been happier with the (Website hidden by Airbnb) apartment is beautiful. Renovated, sunny and well kept, it was perfect for my family. The kitchen and dining room sealed the deal with the dining table where we were able to have a family meal. The eye for detail throughout my family's stay was so helpful- from the instructions on every set of keys, printing out of maps and a binder full of recommendations, I'm definitely going to tell my friends to stay here in the future.  Judy is super easy to get a hold of and happily answered all of my questions. Thanks again, Judy!

If you wanna explore Manhattan and especially Brooklyn (which has so much to offer), this is the place to stay and relax! We felt instantly at home in Judy's stylish apartment, which has every amenity you can think of. Moreover Judy was a kind and helpful host. We recommend this place warmly!

The apartment was clean and uncluttered with a modern kitchen and bathroom.  It met all of our expectations.  My wife loved the fact that the kitchen was well stocked with the basics.  We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Brooklyn to visit our son.  Dave, Cindie, Brian

We've had a great stay at Judy and Sasha's place ! The apartment is spotless, actually larger than it appears on the pictures, has all you need and is very tastefully decorated. Our hosts went out of their way to accommodate our two year old son on a real mattress in the main bedroom. Although the nearby avenue can be a bit loud at night, earplugs are provided, and the cool humming of the aircon happens to cover most of it.

The neighborhood is great ! Lively yet very safe. Within walking distance is the buzzing Fulton Mall, and the more elegant Smith St. and Court St. Plenty of restaurants, bars, bakeries and cafés. Judy and Sasha provided us with a list of their favorite places - Don't miss Van Leeuwen's unforgettable organic Ginger Ice Cream ! Catch the A and C lines at the Hoyt-Schermerhorn station, one block away, and ride to downtown Manhattan in ten minutes... 

Judy and Sasha are discreet hosts, yet very caring. We've been texting prior to our arrival and while we were staying there. They dealt with any little issue in a swift and elegant manner. We really felt like we had settled in Brooklyn for a week, and have left NYC with unforgettable memories. 

---

L'appartement de Judy et Sasha est propre, plus grand que sur les photos, bien équipé et décoré avec goût. Judy et Sasha ont tout fait pour que notre fils de deux ans puisse dormir avec nous dans la chambre sur un vrai matelas. Le bruit de l'avenue peut déranger, surtout la nuit, mais le ronronnement de la clim couvre le plus gros. 
Le quartier est super : d'un côté, Fulton Mall fourmille, et de l'autre, Smith St. et Court St. sont plus élégantes. Le quartier regorge de restos, cafés, bars et boulangeries. Sasha et Judy fournissent une liste de leurs endroits préférés. A un pâté de maison, vous trouverez les lignes A et C à la station Hoyt Schermerhorn, qui vous emmène dans le Sud de Manhattan en dix minutes...
Judy et Sasha sont des hôtes discrets et prévenants. Nous avons échangé par texto avant notre arrivé et pendant notre séjour. Ils ont répondu à toutes nos demandes avec réactivité et élégance. Nous avons vraiment eu l'impression d'habiter Brooklyn le temps d'une semaine et avons quitté NYC avec des souvenirs inoubliables...
Judy was great all around. And the place was lovely and clean and convenient with plenty of space. Would definitely stay there again.

I had an absolutely fabulous time staying in the apartment! The apartment was cosy and tastefully decorated. And It had all the amenities I needed while traveling to New York on business. The apartment was spacious which was great as I dislike small and cramped living spaces. 

The neighborhood felt safe and has some really cool stores that are worth checking out. There are also some nice restaurants, bars, bakeries and cafés. Check out Bacchus! Its a nice french restaurant close to the corner of Bond St. and Atlantic Ave. And for midnight munchies there are a few 24 hour convenience stores near by. It is also worth mentioning that the apartment is within walking distance to the bustling Fulton Mall stretch, where you can find good buys.

I found the Hoyt-Schermerhorn subway station to be very convenient as it was very close to the apartment. You can catch both the A and C lines which will take you in and out of Manhattan in about 10 minutes or so.

Judy was a joy to deal with and I thank her for her hospitality. She answered my questions swiftly and responded to a slight glitch in the internet quickly which was a great help. Even though I was only in New York City for 4 days, I felt like I was just settling in and enjoying all that New York City had to offer. I will definitely return to Judy's place the next time I am in New York!

Judy has an absolutely beautiful apartment!  Great communication the whole time.  My mother enjoyed her stay, and it was right around the corner from my apt.  Quiet, great light, comfortable bed, gorgeous decor, lots of space.  Thanks, Judy!

We had a great time at Judy's apartment. It is very nice, clean and sunny and fully equipped with everything you need during a 5-day city trip. The location is great, it takes just a few minutes by subway to Manhattan downtown. There are a few nice restaurants and coffee bars in the area as well as a small supermarket. We'd definitely come back to this place!
Thanks Judy, you made us feel at home in Brooklyn! 
Stephanie

Judy and her husband are great hosts, and the apartment is beautiful. The building is safe and secure, and the store on the lower level is adorable. Boerum Hill is convenient to get to/from Manhattan, and there are great local restaurants - Building on Bond has amazing coffee. Target is a quick 10-15 minute walk away too, if you forget any toiletries. Judy is always available via text, and she even created a guide to the area that was spot-on. We will definitely come back, it was an awesome experience overall!

This was my first time using Airbnb, and I had such a great experience!!  Judy was the perfect host.  She responded quickly to all of my emails.  I traveled from California to New York with my husband and 9-month-old baby for my brother's wedding in Brooklyn.  The apartment was just a short drive from JFK.  When we entered the apartment, we were really pleased with the modern, eclectic decor (I want her to come and decorate my place in CA!).  I LOVED seeing locally made granola and organic milk and bananas waiting for us in the kitchen.  It made me feel right at home!  Having a small infant, I was very particular about staying in a clean place, and Judy's apartment did not disappoint.  I felt safe preparing my little one's food in the kitchen with the dishes and utensils provided, giving him a bath in the tub, and letting him roam around the living room and bedroom.  Also, the apartment is really close to some great shops and restaurants!  We loved frequenting Grumpy Bert (little store with unique art, toys, gifts, etc.) every day, which is right downstairs from the apartment!  We were also blocks away from Rucola, a tiny Italian restaurant, where we had some of the best pasta ever!  Judy provided us with a folder of cafe/restaurant recommendations, and we loved every single one that we visited!    Next time we go to New York, we will definitely try to stay here again!

We stayed 10 day's at Judy's place. We had a great time and the apartment is beautiful, nice and clean.

For the Dutch people: Het is een feest om hier te vertoeven. Het appartement is erg schoon,  met een prima bed en welvoorziene keuken.En de ijskast gevuld met de  ingrediënten voor een ontbijt.
Ook de locatie is prima. Soms wel wat druk door het verkeer, maar op het nachtkastje liggen oordopjes. Het ligt in een levendige wijk, op de hoek is er een Citibike station en een blok verder is de metro met zowel een directe lijn naar JFK als naar Manhattan . Tenslotte is Judy erg vriendelijk en behulpzaam.
Al met al een prima plek om New York te verkennen.

Myself and my newly wed wife wanted a place to stay in Brooklyn and were lucky enough to find Judy's apartment. It was in an immaculate condition, very stylish and homely.

The location is perfect for being able to explore Brooklyn / Manhattan. Brooklyn Heights and Brooklyn Bridge Park ar a short walk away, and the local Subway station is just round the corner to get to Manhattan or Williamsburg 

Judy was an amazing host and very accommodating to our needs. I could not recommend this place highly enough.

Great stay for exploring NYC! 
We stayed one week at Judy's place. The appartment is modern, clean, nicely furnished and quiet (except for some traffic noise during the day). Judy and her husband Sascha are very helpful. This place is great for exploring NYC (a subway that takes you in 5 min downtown and in 20 min to midtown is only 100 metres away!) from a base-camp in a nice part of Brooklyn. There are plenty of nice bars, restaurants, shops, take-aways and diners around the corner! We would definitely stay at this place again when we would be travelling to NYC again!

Judy's apartment is a very well-maintained, centrally located, comfortable, and welcoming environment.  I booked it for my parents during their visit and they had everything they needed during their stay.  Judy was always available and very accommodating.  My parents are looking forward to their next visit!

Judy's apartment is possibly the best holiday rental I have stayed in whilst in NYC and I have seen a few!
It is light, very spacious, comfortable, full of cool furniture and everything you are likely to need on your trip, from guide books, maps, toiletries, hair dryer, washing machine...you name it, Judy has it. Judy herself and her husband are the perfect hosts, helpful and super responsive yet respectful of your privacy. The neighbourhood is packed with great restaurants and quirky shops and excellent transport facilities but I'll stop right here - if this apartment becomes too popular it may jeopardise my chances of staying there in the future :)

We had a great time at Judy's apartment in this great Brooklyn neighborhood!
The apartment was exactly as pictured; really tastefully decorated and spotless.
The location was perfect for exploring both Manhattan and Boerum Hill. The subway station is around the corner and gets you into the city in 10-15 minutes.
We loved it here and wholeheartedly recommend it!
My only regret is that I never got to meet their dog! :)

This was my first Airbnb stay and I have only great things to say about Judy's place and her hospitality.  The apartment was exactly as presented, beautifully decorated and welcoming.  The location was amazing, a beautiful neighbourhood for walking, as well as very close proximity to the subway lines going into Manhattan.  What made the stay even better were all of the little thoughtful details: fresh milk in the fridge, granola and fruit left as a snack, and lots of great information collected in a handy book including restaurant recommendations for the neighbourhood, subway and bike maps, and car service to the airport.  I would highly recommend a stay here!

We had a great stay at Judy's; the apartment was just what we wanted as far as facilities and location were concerned. We were a few hundred yards from the A line which gives straightforward access into Manhattan and up the west side and it is also within walking distance of many other subway routes. The area around Atlantic avenue abounds in restaurants, cafés, shops and bars but is not as frenetic as parts of Manhattan. Judy was a very kind and helpful host.

Judy and the apartment exceeded my expectations. Judy was easy to coordinate with and lovely. The apartment was a little oasis...a home away from home in every sense. The bed was super comfy, apartment was clean and tidy with all the little amenities you could need (hair dryer, washer/dryer should you need that, and yummy coffee for the morning), and love how they decorated the place.
Overall a great experience - I have bookmarked this place for future visits.
We stayed for a week and loved it. Great hosts, good comunication, lovely Appartement, clean, good equipment, perfect location. We will come back. (:
Loved our stay at Judy's apartment, nicely decorated, new kitchen and bath, very clean, comfortable bed, convenient.  Will return when we are back in Brooklyn!

We had a really wonderful stay in this apartment. The place is spacious, well-maintained, and with many details attended to that make it feel luxurious rather than simply comfortable-- high quality towels and sheets, an ipod dock for music, up to date kitchen appliances, good shower pressure, ear plugs and books by the bedside... I could go on. Judy was courteous and answered all of my questions promptly, even with short notice. The apartment is sunny and cheerful and close to all major subway lines coming into Brooklyn. We hope to come again and this time will schedule less to do in the city so we can spend more time in and around this gem of a space.

When I read Judy’s listing, it met my needs so perfectly that I was worried the real thing would *have* to be a bit of a letdown.  But the real thing turned out to be even better.  The apartment itself is *exactly* as advertised, and Judy and Sasha’s extra touches – a wonderful neighborhood guide with their personal recommendations, thorough instructions for apartment appliances, a starter of granola/milk/fruit, and kind responsiveness to questions -  made our stay as good as we could have imagined.  The proximity to the A/C line is really worth noting, as is having good markets (Brooklyn Fare, Trader Joe’s) and neighborhood restaurants all within easy walking distance.  It’s a wonderful place to stay while visiting New York.

My fiancée and I stayed here for four nights while our furniture was being shipped from New York to San Francisco. The place is just as nice as it looks in the photos, the building and neighborhood are quiet and there were a number of thoughtful small touches, like a great guide to the local restaurants, lots of New York-themed books and art and some breakfast fixings. It's extremely convenient to subways as well. One note: If you stay there when it's cold, you might need to ask Judy to turn up the thermostat, as we did. There are radiators in the apartment but the master control is in her unit. But we were there during the Polar Vortex, so you probably won't have that problem.

We stayed at Judy's apartment for 5 nights, and it was wonderful! Judy is pleasant and responsive. 
The apartment is chic and very clean, in a great hip Brooklyn neighborhood. All in all a great experience.

I live in the neighborhood and got this apartment for my dad to stay while visiting.  Since I live here, I checked out a few places in Boerum Hill before picking one and this was certainly the nicest of the available options. 
Everything worked out great and Judy was a fantastic host.

I had a great time in Boerum Hill, Brooklyn. Judy and her husband were great hosts, they were caring and helpful.
The apt looked exactly as the pictures and the neighborhood felt friendly. It was great to have the metro station, were the A train were passing by, som close. 
I can certainly recommend the apartment for anyone looking to stay in Brooklyn, but at the same time be close to Manhattan, which you are because of the A train.
We had our two year old son with us and there is two playgrounds not so far from the apt.

This was a wonderful apartment.  We enjoyed the light, the privacy, the comfy bed and the coffee experience.  It was new for us to grind our beans and drip our coffee!  The apartment was well stocked in the kitchen and bath, plus there is a washer and dryer!

The location is very convenient and safe.  I highly recommend Judy and her apartment.

In mid March my two daughters and I stayed at Judy's apartment in Boerum Hill for four nights.  This was not my first stay in Brooklyn, but it was the first time I had rented an apartment, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  The pictures of the apartment and the various communications from Judy were on point, but pictures are just that.  We could not have been happier upon arrival.  The apartment was very clean, sunny as the pictures had projected and had all the amenities we needed to have a relaxing four day break.  We like to cook and found the kitchen well stocked with all the conveniences necessary.  I could tell you of all the little extras Judy made available, but I'll just say we were very comfortable.  Judy was out of town but stayed in touch to make sure we were happy.  This was a very pleasant experience and one I would recommend to anyone wanting to visit Brooklyn or the big city.  When I return, and I will, I know where I'm staying.  Thanks Judy.

We spent 7 days in this light and beatiful appartment. Judy is very friendly and we felt us welcome. There were plenty of tea and coffee, the good one☺️.
It is very easy to take the metro to Manhattan, but we also took it to Brighton and spent a day at the sea. 
The neigbourhood is cosy with many nice restaurants and farmers markets. Take the bus up to Prospect Park and have a walk back. Nice bookshop and toyshop in 7.avenue.
We will come back some other time.
Many greetings from Jette and Ebbe in Copenhagen, Denmark.
We were very happy at Judy's apartment in Boerum Hill. Bright, spacious, comfortable, convenient to transportation, thoughtful host. Highly recommended!

We stayed 9 nights in this apartment. The apartment is bright and clean and has everything you need to feel at home. There are many N.Y. travel guide books to help you plan your days. It was great to come home and get into a comfortable bed at the end of a big day of sightseeing. 
If you are planning on attending any sporting or music events at the Barclays Centre you will be happy to know that the centre is only a few minutes walk away.
You are completely self contained and private in this apartment but the owners only live upstairs and are available if you have a problem. Judy kept in contact through messaging and she was so helpful and able to answer of my queries.
We stayed in Manhattan for several nights before coming to this apartment and we felt that we had a true NY experience staying in Boerum Hill. 
Weekly subway travel cards are only $30.00 for the week and we found it really easy to get around NY and beyond. There is a subway stop only one and a half blocks away.
We really enjoyed our stay.

We had just a little contact with Judy, who lives upstairs, and was warm and helpful when we had questions or requests.  This is an exquisite unit, decorated in an interplay between a simple design taste that uses focused colored and the elaborate molding, French doors and arches of the building itself, downplayed in a uniform white, to elegant effect.   The Apple TV was a useful addition, much more appreciated than any number of cable channels.  The dining room and kitchen were ample for a take-in meal with guests, and we could have cooked more elaborately had we wanted.

We stayed in Judy's lovely apartment for 6 days with our 2 children. The apartment was clean and comfortable with a new bathroom and kitchen with the most necessary utensils to cook meals. The apartment decor is very nice and the kids loved the opportunity to watch Netflix movies. You quickly feel like being at home and the apartment looks exactly as on the photos.

The location is great with a short distance to the subway to Manhattan and JFK airport - and within walking distance to many of Brooklyn's nice neighborhoods: Dumbo, Prospects park, Brooklyn Bridge area, etc. Smith street is a great place to do shopping. Brooklyn Fare, a delicious organic grocery store is close to the subway which is very convenient on your way home after a long day in Manhattan.

Judy is a welcoming and helpful host, easy to get in touch with if necessary. We will definitely return to Judy's apartment on future visits to New York and can highly recommend the apartment to friends and everyone else.
Fin leilighet sentralt i Brooklyn. Rolig område. Veldig hyggelig vertskap som gav gode råd  og tips om steder å besøke i nabolaget.

Our experience with both Judy and her apartment met or exceeded all of our expectations.
The description of the apartment is accurate. It is bright/sunny, quiet, clean, well appointed. It is perfectly located close to attractions, transportation, restaurants, groceries, boutiques, antique stores and more.
Judy provided whatever we needed, responding quickly to our request. In addition, she knew how to give us all the privacy we wanted.
We highly recommend this wonderful stay!

We had a great stay at this fantastic flat. Child save and very well located. Our 1,5yr old daughter didn't hv much to take apart or fall off from. We enjoyed this very well situated flat with good access to subway, deli's and restaurants/take always. Only to recommend and I'd go back there any time. Needless to say that I'm a Brooklyn fan whatsoever. Kitchen and bath is well equipped- being able doing a laundry certainly helps with a toddler.

We had a great time in Judy's appartment ! 
It's beautifully decorated, spacious and warm in a very cool neighborhood. 
Judy's description is completely accurate, both for the appartment, for transportation facilities or for the neighbourhood (nice shops and restaurants : you have to taste Rucola, nice and trendy italian restaurant !). 
She is also a very charming host, helpful and accommodating.
We definitely recommend this location.

We absolutely LOVED Judy's apartment! It was so beautiful, clean and spacious. The apartment is situated in a lovely area of Brooklyn with lots of cafes and restaurants only a short walk away on Smith street. There were also 3 train stations in close walking distance to the apartment. We spent a lot of time in Manhattan as it was only 1 stop on the subway! Judy was a very helpful host, getting back to is really quickly if we had any questions. Will definitely return and recommend to others :)

We spent 3 weeks at Judy's apartment and what a great/lovely place to stay! 
Spacious, lightful, comfortable and beautifully decorated. Just as described.
We wanted to discover Brooklyn and Boerum Hill was the perfect place to start.  A charming neighborhood with great restaurants, cafes, groceries and an easy access by subway or even bus to the so many key sights of Brooklyn and Manhattan.
And Judy was so nice and helpful: simply a great host!
We had a great time and would love to come back.

This was my first Airbnb experience and I couldn't have hoped for a better one…I loved my stay in Judy's apartment.  She is the most charming host and so helpful and kind.  I loved the thoughtful personal touches with granola and milk and apples for breakfast (I arrived very late at night). 
The apartment is lovely, light and airy and I immediately felt like it was my own..the area around has everything you need, lots of subways within easy walking distance and restaurants and shops right on your doorstep…hope to be back soon! Thanks again Judy!

We had a great time at Judys lovely Brooklyn apartment. It was exactly like the photos lots of lovely attention to detail and very clean. Yes it's noisy but that's city living and as we live in london it certainly wasn't a problem. The folder provided with tips on local restaurants and cafés was a nice touch and we tried quite a few of Judys recommendations. Would definitely recommend this lovely apartment.

We greatly enjoyed our stay at Judy and Sasha's Boerum Hill apartment.  The pictures set up a high level of expectation and the reality did not disappoint, the apartment was beautiful, well-decorated, and clean.

As someone who had lived in Brooklyn previously, I appreciated that the apartment gave me the experience again of "living" in a Brooklyn neighborhood.  Along with all the nearby restaurants and conveniences, especially nice was the fact that the apartment was in a very central location; whether one wanted to walk around to nearby neighborhoods in Brooklyn or take one of many close-by subway lines into Manhattan, one could do so quickly and easily.  

We also greatly appreciated the small thoughtful touches that made us feel welcome and allowed us to quickly acclimate to the apartment and neighborhood.  Judy and Sasha allowed us to check in early and had granola, yogurt, fresh fruit and coffee waiting for us-- all of which we were quite thankful for after a long red-eye flight.  The thorough notes of information and instructions regarding the area and the apartment also made it clear that these were hosts who thought of nearly everything that might make their guests' stay better and left no detail unconsidered. 

We would definitely stay in the apartment again, should we be lucky enough to find it available next time we come to NYC.

I took my parents to NYC and chose Judy's place to stay. It was pure perfection. The area is super nice. On Atlantic Avenue you'll find nice restaurants and a corner store that sells all necessary food items (bread, baguette, cheese, etc). So especially after a busy day in Manhattan, Brooklyn is just a good place to calm down and relax.
The apartment itself is as described. The bed was super comfortable and the kitchen sufficiently equipped (however we only had breakfast there).
You do not need to bring any shampoo, hair dryer, etc. It's all there.

This being said, I would come back at any time!

Thanks, Judy!

I have found my home in New York, the apartment is great and a fav of mine now.

Judy was lovely and dealt with the one issue we had very fairly and promptly.

Bed good, shower good, large apartment, nice sun, quiet, air com good but loud.

Stay here and enjoy Brooklyn.

Wir hatten eine großartige Zeit in Judys geschmackvollen Apartment. Wir waren mit unserer 5jährigen Tochter dort und hatten genug Platz. Die Wohnung ist die perfekte Ausgangsbasis für viele Aktivitäten, und wir waren oft froh, nach einem turbulenten Trip nach Manhattan wieder in unserem ruhigeren Brooklyn zu sein.  Judy ist bei Fragen aller Art immer ansprechbar. Vielen Dank! Wir kommen wieder!

What an amazing apartment!  Great location close to subway, grocery stores , and incredible eateries!  We were in town for our daughter's wedding. We took pictures of her getting ready in the apartment and will always remember this fabulous apartment in those pictures and the fond memories we made in Brooklyn.

The apartment was tastefully furnished, the kitchen was beautiful and the bed was oh so comfortable.  We will stay here again if we come back for a visit!

Judy did a great job accommodating us with: easy key access, a welcome packet on good places in the area (including personal descriptions of area stops), some treats within the apartment, high-speed WiFi, and very clean place.  

Noise in the apartment was extremely low, especially for the city. Bathroom/shower was great for a couple people, and the washer and dryer was a pleasant surprise.

Really could not ask for anything more, and made our NYC trip very enjoyable.

We simply loved this apartment!! Everything was perfect, very beautifully and comfortably equiped and furnished, communication always warm and easy going, instructions clear and guidebook with restaurant tips etc. fabulous. The subway just a stone's throw away. The area very and pleasant lovely. We will come back!

This was my first AirBnB experience & it was a great one. Judy is a super-responsive host (both before & during our stay). The apartment was cosy & clean, & felt like home. The location is also excellent as it was just 2 blocks away from the subway & there were also 24-hours groceries nearby. Thanks again Judy for everything, and allowing us to store our luggages, both before & after our check-in & check-out times. We really appreciate it. Highly recommended!!! :)

My wife and I really have enjoyed staying in 82 Bond Street (Brooklyn). The apartment is wonderful. The neighborhood is just great. For nearly one week, we did stay in Brooklyn exploring it. We even did not go to Manhattan!!
The location of the flat is very good and for a one bedroom, there is plenty of space. We really recommend this flat.

Our experience staying in Judy's apartment was nothing but positive.  She was onhand when we arrived to let us into the apartment (and even offered to help us carry our bags up the flight of stairs) and to show us where things were.  The apartment was as nice (and as clean) as shown in the photos, and was equipped with everything needed for a comfortable stay.  It is perfectly placed to discover the surrounding Brooklyn neighbourhoods (leafy tree-lined streets filled with vintage furniture stores, boutiques, food stores, small restaurants and cafes) yet is also very conveniently located to all subway lines into Manhattan.  We would highly recommend it to anyone.

Judy's apartment was beautiful and in an awesome location! Easy access to all major public transit trains and a really cute neighborhood. A large apartment by NYC standards to boot, super clean and Judy was a pleasure.  We even checked in early despite our later check-in time.  Thanks so much for the hospitality!

I wish I would have had more time to enjoy this place more. I was on a business trip, so I only used this place for sleeping, and barely saw it in daylight. However the mornings I spent in the kitchen/dining room were incredibly sunny and peaceful. Really enjoyed this place which reminded me of home. It has that old New York charm that all these new condos are lacking. 
The apartment has everything you need for a short or long stay. Bathroom and kitchen are newly renovated, and the washer/dryer and dishwasher are a dream for any New Yorker (although my short stay didnt require neither of them). 
The location couldnt be more ideal for Brooklyn, you are anywhere in a second. The tips in the hosts welcome book are spot on.
The checking in and communication with the host was excellent.

We were very pleased with our 10 day stay in the apartment.  The hosts provided a detailed "users guide" which also included neighborhood shopping and restaurant recommendations. The kitchen is spacious and outfitted. Although we mostly used it for quick meals it is well suited for real cooking and includes a large refrigerator and dishwasher.

The apartment is spacious, clean, and comfortable. There were even fresh flowers on the dining (Website hidden by Airbnb) looks like the photos.  There were a number of guidebooks and maps available.

The neighborhood is interesting, offering a variety of shops and restaurants within walking distance. There a a number of subway lines which can be reached with a short walk, including an express train to Manhattan.  We were very satisfied with our stay and hope to return.

Judy greeted us with a big smile.  She made herself available if we needed anything.  She provided maps and brochures which covered many activities in the area.  We did a lot of walking different times of the day and felt very comfortable.  The rooms were sunny and inviting.  The bed was very comfortable.  The room temps were warm enough during the day and nicely cooler  for sleeping.  We are readers and appreciated the lights on each nightstand.  The updated bath and kitchen are well equipped and large for NY.  I loved the Bosch gas stove and appreciated the  nice sized refrigerator.  There was plenty of hot water.  We so appreciated the two clothes racks with an abundance of sturdy wood hangers.

This was our first AirBnB experience and it went without a hitch. We loved every minute staying in this expansive and comfortable apartment and would happily return.

Booking/Arrival: Judy and Alex made the booking system really straightforward and responded via email promptly to all our questions before arriving re getting from airport, car services, weather etc etc. Due to timings we used a key safe to retrieve keys - no issues at all.

Apartment: Exactly as described and photographed. It is a really lovely light and airy proper 1 bedroom apartment. The bed is a comfy US queen-size (5ft) bed with a good mattress - we slept soundly every night. For two, the space was great, we loved having the bedroom, lounge and dining room to spread out in. The bathroom - often the thing that lets down many places has been refitted recently and is very clean, it has a decent power-shower with piping hot water and a separate nook for the laundry appliances. The sofa in the lounge was large and comfy, great for lazing on after day on your feet. Kitchen is well equipped and a dishwasher was nice touch. There's the right amount of furniture and it's neither overcrowded & cluttered nor minimalist. The heating worked well and we were never cold (stayed in mid Dec) - the heating is old so you experience the hiss and whoosh of the steam pipes but we found it strangely comforting.

Location: Steps from Atlantic Avenue, 3 blocks from the multitude of subway lines running through the Atlantic Avenue terminal (where you buy your Metro Card) which whizz you into Manhattan within 20 mins. The area is full of independent boutique shops, lovely restaurants and cafes - some dangerously close. It's a great spot to explore Brooklyn from as well: we took a suggested walk from our hosts and covered Cobble Hill, Caroll Gardens, Brooklyn Heights as well as Boerum Hill. The Brooklyn Bridge Park is well worth a visit. There was so much to do and see, we simply couldn't fit everything in. You're also only a 15min walk away the top end of Prospect Park.

Hosts: Anytime we had a question, Judy or Alex responded very quickly by email with suggestions or information accordingly. We never got to meet them but then we were out all day, every day of our 6 night stay. They were simply wonderful and were able to give us a late check out which was much appreciated. They thought of all sorts of little things e.g. earplugs for city living, fresh milk, a host of useful maps and their guide to local restaurants and services. We were so happy staying here, we would have asked to stay another week had our schedule allowed it.

We wouldn't hesitate to say 'stay here' or return ourselves.
Great neighbourhood, close to plenty of restaurants, cafes, food and a subway station. Apartment was perfect for the three of us.

A lovely spacious bright flat in a fantastic location. Everything we needed for a week's stay in New York. 
Lots to do locally but also excellent and easy transport links to Manhattan and beyond. 
Judy was very helpful and friendly with excellent communication throughout.
We loved the flat and had a great stay!

The apartment was fantastic. Great location near restaurants, shops, great market and the subway.  Subway a 5 minute walk and 19 minute ride to Lower ManhattanWas quiet for a city location and Judy provided ear plugs for the uninitiated (I travel with a sleep sound file on my iPhone so am not bothered by noise - but noticed the quiet when I took them off).  

Judy was a great host. The place was clean and looked like the pictures but was larger and even nicer than I expected. Would HIGHLY recommend to others

I booked the apartment for my folks who were visiting from India. Not only was the apartment gorgeous and in a great location, but Judy was also very accommodating with check-in/check-out times. She also had tea, sugar etc. available, and my folks very incredibly happy with the place.

Judy is wonderful! Accommodating and helpful. My mother came to stay and Judy's place was the perfect spot for her. Comfortable, clean, and (Website hidden by Airbnb) was just what we were looking for! We would enthusiastically recommend her listing to anyone looking in this area.

Judy's place was a really wonderful place for our NYC and Brooklyn excurion.  Most notable is the very large living and dining space with large windows on both ends that make it a very bright and desirable place for retreat throughout the day.  We are a family of four and found it very spacious, clean and with good amenities. We rented the second bedroom for our kids which worked out well.  

Judy is a very nice and  responsive host.  We used Judy's place for the first half our NYC vacation and stayed in the East Village for the remainder.  We found this location the most comfortable with good access to subways, and fine local restaurants and shopping.

This is my second stay at 82 Bond St.  My daughters and I love this apartment.  It's clean, it's roomy, and we are able to cook, which we all enjoy.  The neighborhood is safe, there are corner groceries available with fresh produce and if you are patient and can figure out the street cleaning schedule, you can find parking easily enough.  Judy is always available either by phone, text or email and very accommodating.  We plan to return next year, and hopefully will be able to stay here again.  Judy's place suits all our needs.  I would highly recommend her apartment if you plan a stay in Brooklyn or the big city.
Perfect. Just perfect!
Perfect apartment for our trip - exactly as described, and a very pleasant homebase for all of us. We plan to stay whenever we visit Brooklyn.

We stayed here for a week in April with our six-month-old son. Judy was great. She was really helpful and the arrival and departure went really smoothly. The apartment is in a great part of Brooklyn and is a spacious one-bedroom place with a nice living room and kitchen/diner. It's just round the corner from the subway and it's just a few stops into Manhattan. There are also really good restaurants and great grocery stores within a few minutes of the apartment. We were easily able to drive right up to the apartment to drop off our luggage and Judy had left a really good guide about the local area with everything we needed to know. She was sweet enough to leave us fresh milk and baby juice in the fridge and the kitchen is a really good size with great oven, dishwasher and fridge/freezer. There is also good room in the bathroom for the washer/dryer. Would really recommend to anyone looking for a  place in Brooklyn.

Da Judy ed Alex abbiamo avuto un'accoglienza ottima e ci hanno dato molte indicazioni di dove e come andare ed una folta lista di posti per mangiare.
La descrizione della casa corrisponde a quella pubblicata.E' semplice, ma curata nei dettagli. Abbiamo avvertito una buona atmosfera. Letto comodo e confortevole.
Brooklyn è interessante e piacevole. Si può passeggiare per Brooklyn, Brooklyn Heights Dumbo  e raggiungere gli altri quartieri, inclusa Manhattan, con la metro a pochi passi da casa.

The apartment is gorgeous - spacious and ideally located in Brooklyn (all subways needed are very close by and there are lots of nice and comfortable restaurants, bars and cafes in the area). Everything was very clean and the apartment is nicely furnished and equipped with everything you'd probably need. We would definitively come back and we highly recommend this place.

Judy and Alex were very accommodating and allowed us an early check in.  They had milk and cereal available for us, which was very appreciated as we came in on a red eye flight.  The apartment was quite large by NYC standards, and was clean and elegant.  The neighborhood was safe and several restaurants were within a block or two.  WiFi and apple TV were great for the kids.

Our stay at Judy's was absolutely fantastic. We spent 10 nights and were sorry to leave. The location is very easy to access via subway as it runs on the A, C and G lines. Going to Manhattan, Williamsburg, Coney Island etc was no problem whatsoever and the station is only 1 minute walk away.

Everything we needed was provided. We decided not to pack towels and were relived to find that these were ready for us. Many kitchen, laundry and bathroom essentials were provided too. TV, cable and Apple TV were easy to use.

We felt a great deal of independence in our apartment, and loved sitting at the dining table in the evening with a cool beer and sore feet, plotting our adventures for the next day.

Thank you Judy; New York will always be Boerum Hill for us!

great accommodation in a great location
brooklyn has good bars and cafes away from the hustle and bustle of manhattan, with good subway links when needed

This apartment is really beautiful - even more so than the pictures show. It's very quiet and the location is amazing. It was well supplied with towels, toiletries, coffee and breakfast. We loved access to the washer and dryer, so helpful. And the guide provided was really thorough.

El apartamento era tal como se veía en las fotos, luminoso, limpio y confortable
Al llegar tuvimos una acogedora bienvenida; Judy nos recibió con café, tés, leche y galletitas. Muy reconfortantes después de un largo viaje.
Toallas y ropa de cama impecables.
El vecindario muy lindo, lleno de negocios y tiendas a pocos minutos, donde se puede encontrar lo que se necesite.
La ubicación excelente, cerca de líneas de subtes que te llevan a Manhattan y al aeropuerto en un breve trayecto.
Y Judy siempre a mano para cualquier consulta que necesitamos hacerle.
Recomendamos este apartamento. Lo pasamos genial en él!!

This was my second stay at this wonderful apartment and I plan to book another stay within the next few months. The location is fabulous and the apt. is bright and cheery! Amazingly, you have complete privacy even though the owners live on the top floor of this beautiful brownstone. (Judy and Alex are only a ring or text away to answer your questions or respond to requests and are incredibly lovely people!) The modern kitchen with a full sized refrigerator, incredible stove/oven AND dishwasher --not to mention granite countertops--is such a treat to have in New York where eating out for every meal can be quite pricey. (My only request would be some additional pots/pans and dinner ware for guests like me who like to cook and have some meals at home.) The biggest bonus for long term guests is the full sized washer and dryer! The bottom line is this apt. is cute and cozy with all the amenities of a full sized home and I can't wait to book my next visit! By the way, if you worry about street noise, NO WORRIES! This flat is located on a side street and with closed windows I never heard a thing. Wonderful restaurants, coffee shops, and cafes just steps out your door, as well as grocery stores and boutiques that offer everything you could ever want/need. Subway stations nearby and easy to access virtually any line. (Note: We always rent the second bedroom for our teen aged son who wants his own private space. It works beautifully!)  Thank you Judy and Alex!

The apartment was perfect and in a great, central location. The place was as described, clean, and extremely quiet, especially given its proximity to new construction and busy streets. We didn't hear a thing and slept soundly. Would definitely stay here again while I'm in BK. thanks!

I booked this apartment for my mom, dad and sister for a visit to see me in Brooklyn.  Just down the street from my apartment, it seemed the perfect fit!  Judy and I stayed in contact up to their arrival, and she was quick to reply and clear in her instructions.  I was very pleased!  My mom wrote the following about their experience:

"What a pleasant surprise to find such a sweet place for our 3-night stay in Brooklyn!  The security of three locked doors to get to the stairs was a challenge, but very welcome, as we felt quite safe.  There is easy walk to Hoyt metro station.  From the front windows one can see down Bond to Atlantic, which is an easy area for eateries and necessities.  From the back windows one looks out on green garden below and greenery of trees.  The place was very clean, the bed was great, the wood floors and eclectic décor were fun.  Both kitchen and bath have been updated nicely.  We would definitely stay again and recommend."

Judy se merece ampliamente su calificación de super host. La comunicación excelente. El departamento es tal cual las fotos, todo funcionando perfectamente, muy cómodo, luminoso y confortable. La cocina, la heladera, el baño, la cama, todo excelente. Y la ubicación muy cómoda tanto para ir a Manhattan con el subte como para recorrer Brooklyn. Lo recomiendo 100% y volvería sin dudar. Felicitaciones Judy!

I rented the apartment for my In laws. They had a lovely stay.  The apartment was in a quiet area, walking distance to many subway lines and downtown Brooklyn. A short walk away from us in Cobble Hill. Apartment was comfortable and Judy was available for any questions regarding the place. Txs Judy!

The listing description was accurate.  Judy was very helpful prior to our visit and at the time of departure.  The apartment was very clean and comfortable.  The access to the subway, dining and local coffee shop make it a perfect selection.  We will be back.  Thanks Judy!

Gosh you couldn't ask for a better apartment if you're looking to rent an entire one out, this was everything we could ask for, and more! The little touches like having fresh coffee, milk and granola made our start to the day easy, as did having all of the things like a washing machine, hairdryer, tv with Netflix and a comfy bed. We highly recommend Brooklyn Fare (which is just around the corner) to get all of your fresh food/pre-prepared food - amazing! There are a few different train lines all within walking distance also, so it's not hard to get into Manhattan. 
We'll definitely stay here again if we come back to NYC!

Julie and Alex were very helpful and always quick to respond whenever we needed. The house is perfectly located in a very nice area and the apartment is sunny during the day and quiet and cosy at night, beautifully decorated with comfortable beds and very clean and fresh!

Judy was a very helpful host. My wife and I enjoyed ourselves very much in her lovely, spacious and well furnished apartment. Her extra bedroom was useful for a few visits by single family members. The location is good, quiet and safe. We plan to stay there again next year when we visit our daughter who lives nearby.

Judy's apartment was great for our 10 night visit to New York. The apartment had all required facilities and was extremely clean and well maintained. It was our first time staying in Brooklyn rather than Manhattan and we found it to be perfect. Subway is only a short stroll away, Brooklyn Fare Market around the corner for all your supplies and a great choice of restaurants along Smith St.

Judy was very prompt and responsive with emails and explained everything about getting to and into the apartment very clearly. Once we were there, we were thrilled by the apartment! We used to live in the neighborhood, and were very pleased to find the airbnb was even better located and better appointed than our old place. The apartment was clean, spacious, and very comfortable, and is walking distances to many of Brooklyn's best cafes and restaurants, as well as several trains to get into the city. Highly recommend!

Bonito apartamento en Brooklyn con buenos accesos a las lineas de metro que nosotros utilizamos para ir a Manhattan.  Estuvimos muy bien. Aprovechamos para visitar tambien la propia zona de Brooklyn y fuimos a uno de los restaurantes de la zona sugeridos por Judy y estuvo muy bien.
Nos pudieron guardar las maletas ya que teníamos el vuelo por la tarde.

Judy's place in Brooklyn made our NYC trip a super memorable one! The house was much nicer than the photos, we were pleasantly surprised with the clean, well-decorated, spacious, warm, and newly renovated house. I was there with my Mom (her first time in NY) and all she talked about after the trip was how nice the apartment was, and how she looked forward to going back "home" after a long day out sightseeing in NYC.
The apartment is in a great neighborhood, few blocks from the subway, close to markets, shops, and restaurants. The kitchen is very well equipped so you can make a quick meal if needed as well.
In short - this is one of the best airbnbs i've stayed in a while and i totally recommend judy's apartment!!

L'appartamento è bello, confortevole e pulito. La zona è carina e nelle immediate vicinanze ci sono stazioni di varie linee della metropolitana. Judy è molto gentile e disponibile: ad esempio, prima del nostro arrivo a NY, ci ha inviato un messaggio con moltissimi consigli su ristoranti e bar della zona. Inoltre, ci ha portato una coperta in più quando la temperatura è scesa di molto. Abbiamo trovato latte e cereali per la colazione, té, caffè e un gelato in freezer. 
Insomma: appartamento super consigliato!

Yet another fabulous stay in Brooklyn in the "Sunny Boerum Hill Apartment!" This was my 3rd or 4th stay and I'll be back again and again.  This comfortable and exceptionally clean apartment has everything you need for a few days or a few weeks in New York City, including a modern kitchen, bath and laundry.  It is located in a wonderful area near Brooklyn Heights and Cobble Hill/Carroll Gardens, and is within a short walk to several subway stations as well as many restaurants and plenty of shops. The owners live upstairs but you will see them only as much as you like. They are responsive and helpful with plenty of suggestions should you need them.  The wifi is great and the bed very comfy... what more could you ask? Thank you again, Judy and Sascha! See you in October!

What a lovely stay we had in Judy's apartment! It was clean, spacious, comfortable and well-located, and Judy was helpful and available to answer questions and generally make us feel at home.

All in all a great experience, and I'm sure we'll return in the future.

Had a fantastic stay here in Brooklyn. Location of the flat is great with 2 min walk to subway line to Manhattan. Judy was extremely helpful from the start of the trip just checking in once to make sure we were OK. Flat is spacious with everything you could need including guide books. Overall would highly recommend to anyone looking to explore Brooklyn, Williamsburg and Manhattan.

We stayed in Judy's apartment for a week in February. The apartment is as described in all previous reviews. Spacious, comfortable, warm, well furnished, secure. The kitchen and bathroom are both modern and well equipped. Wi-Fi is fast and reliable, heaps of TV channels and numerous transport options close by. Judy was a delight to deal with, prompt, efficient and no fuss. Highly recommend.

This is an adorable place in a cool part of Brooklyn, we had a super smooth check in even with getting in late and the apartment was a cozy place to arrive to! Felt like home with some essentials in the fridge and light cereal options available.  Really clean and had a very upscale feel! Would highly recommend this apartment if you are interested in checking out Brooklyn- and it only took us 20 min to get into manhattan on the subway.
This was a great apartment in a perfect neighborhood. Judy and Alex were very helpful and made everything easy!

Ho soggiornato con mio marito e mio figlio di 9 anni nell'appartamento di Judy per una settimana, l'appartamento è grande e molto bene organizzato, veramente full optional. Judy che abita al piano superiore è stata molto gentile sia al check-in in orario serale che al check-out offrendoci di lasciare le valge fino alla nostra partenza in tarda serata. all'interno abbiamo trovato tutte le indicazioni necessarie su bar ristoranti e funzionamento degli elettrodomestici. il quartiere è meraviglioso, sicuro e vicino a molte stazioni della metropolitana. Consiglio vivamente questo appartamento e sicuramente lo sceglierò dinuovo per i miei viaggi a New York!!! Thank you Judy 
Francesca

The place was perfect in every possible way - even better than we expected! A very clean, surprisingly big and spacious apartment in a location that is perfect for getting around basicly everywhere in NYC. The closest subway station was just a few minutes walk from the apartment and from there you get quickly to Manhattan, Williamsburg, Greenpoint (also other Brooklyn locations) and to our pleasent surprise, the airport. The area itself is very nice, especially south of the apartment. 

Judy gave us our privacy which suits us Finns :) but made sure that she is available if needed. Her booklet with tips and recomendations was so helpful that we didn't actually need Judy's personal help at all.

All and all, maybe the best AirBnB experience so far! 5/5

This was a fantastic find and I feel lucky that it was available for the time that we needed it. The apartment had everything we needed, was walking distance to the subway, nice neighborhood (we felt safe),was clean (no bugs),and was stocked with little things like toilet paper, sugar, spices, olive oil and light breakfast.  The hosts were very accommodating and friendly!not intrusive. I had read very good reviews and must say that even with the good reviews, this visit exceeded our expectations.

The apartment is absolutely gorgeous, charming, comfortable, sunny and very calm.
The neighbourhood is fantastic with lots of good restaurants and shops, and at walking distance from the Brooklyn bridge and from Prospect Park, and 10 minutes away from Manhattan by subway or taxi.
Judy and Alex were very accommodating: We checked in earlier than expected, and were able to leave our luggage on the day we checked out as our flight was in the evening
They were also very helpful, recommending great places to eat and to drink. They also provide a very useful guide book of the neighbourhood, with every info you might need.
We'll definitely be back !!!

Judy's apartment is beautiful and cozy and the photos are not enough to tell how nice it is! My family members stayed there for three days and they enjoyed each moment there because everything worked perfectly and was taken care of. I'll definitely recommend it to other visitors. 

Thank you, Judy!

very good appartement, very good location, very friendly an professional host!
We had a wonderful stay in NY!

I stayed here with a friend while visiting other friends in Brooklyn.  We loved the place and the location!!  The apartment is clean and spacious with beautiful minimalist decor.  It was actually more space than we needed! :)  The bed was comfy and the bathroom/kitchen was stocked with basics like dishes, hairdryer, etc.  The location is awesome!  Easy walking distance to tons of great restaurants, multiple metro stations, and beautiful neighborhoods.  There are grocery stores nearby, too, if you want to stock the fridge.  We felt very safe in the apartment and surrounding neighborhood, even at night.  Great place!!  Judy was easy to contact and checked in on us through text, which was nice.  Can't wait to return!  :)

I had a really lovely stay at the apartment. Judy helped me to get my suitcases up the stairs when I came and the kitchen had a few snacks and milk so that I didn't have to make an immediate run to the grocery store when I got there. The lightbulb burnt out and I had trouble with the apple tv soon after I got there, and Judy was there within the hour to help me out. She even invited me to the party she was having on Memorial Day (unfortunately I couldn't go!) and was thoughtful enough to check with me about going to work the next day and made sure to wrap things up early so I could go to bed on time. She provided a book with recommendations for places to eat and when she found out my friend is a novelist, emailed recommendations for where to write and meet other authors.  I couldn't have asked for a more thoughtful, considerate host, who was always available when I needed her! That said, I didn't need her much at all because the apartment was just perfect. Lots of room and lots of light, and very comfy. I didn't want to leave!

Judy's apartment was great.  The location off Atlantic Avenue was fantastic, everything we needed was within a short walk.  Subway connectivity into Manhattan and the rest of Brooklyn is very good in the area.  Super convenient to have a washer and dryer at our disposal, the kitchen was well-equipped.  Judy was out of the country for work but Alex was around and made sure everything went smoothly.

Host greeted us at the door and spent time showing us the apartment and recommending places to visit in the neighborhood. He was very friendly and helpful. We would love to stay again in the future and would definitely recommend the apartment to others.

Great week-long stay. The apartment was large, clean, and stocked with everything we needed for the week. The location was also perfect for public transportation access. Judy and Alex were accessible by phone/email anytime and we really enjoyed our stay :)

A fabulous apartment in a great location. The hosts were welcoming and extremely helpful during our stay. Giving us ideas on the local area and even kindly stocking our fridge with essentials. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Appartement au 1er étage d'une maison fin XIXème typique de Brooklyn. Un havre de paix au milieu de la "jungle" de NY!
déco épurée et fonctionnelle très sympa.
Le lit est top: on récupère bien des longues balades... et l'appart est très calme et bien isolé. Pour 2 ou 3 personnes, c'est un lieu parfait tout près en métro de Manhattan ou de Coney Island. Pas mal de restos sympas à qq minutes.
Judy et Alex, son mari ont tout fait pour faciliter notre séjour.

Perfect! 
We loved the place. Well located. Nice decoration with all the electric appliances you need. And very good bed!

Perfect. The area has great character and with lots to offer, we had everything available at our doorstep. Judy was a fantastic host, we didn't get to meet her, but she made sure all our needs were met. She was always available and provided plenty of information when requested. The apartment is lovely, delightfully renovated, impeccably kept with amazing attention to detail. Judy provides a guide/manual of the apartment, where everything is explained from how to work the tv, trash days, cooling system, and lists of restaurants in the vicinity. The kitchen is well equipped, everything you need to make you feel right at home. All the elements (linen, towels etc) provided, everything was in perfect condition. Only comment, a fan or a/c in the bedroom would be good for hot summer nights as the a/c is at the far end of the lounge.

We spent 5 night's at Judy's apartment. We needed the use of the second bedroom, as our 20 year old daughter was joining us for the duration. The second bedroom is separate from the main room and is accessed off the hallway. For us this was no issue at all, but for someone with small children, this may not be a perfect situation. I would like to point out that this is made very clear when you read Judy's description and when you make your booking.

The above is the only minor point with the apartment.

From the very start of our booking / stay, it was clear that Judy would be a great host. All communication was so quick and helpful. The apartment is spacious, clean and well maintained. The location to the tube station is perfect (2 minute walk). The information left in the apartment is clear and helpful. 

It would have been nice if there was a guest book for us to leave comments in regarding our stay and findings in the area. It's always nice to be able to see what  other guests have done and recommended. But Judy had compiled a list of places to eat and visit. 

We would highly recommend this apartment without any hesitation and if we returned to Brooklyn, this would be the first place I would check for accommodation.

Thank you Judy for allowing us to stay in your beautiful apartment.

Regards Shaun, Diane and Kayla
We live in the area and our parents have stayed at Judy's place several times now. Fantastic experience every time, and this one was no exception.

We were glad to have stayed at Judy's spacious apartment for our 8 nights visiting NYC. The space is large and welcoming and very quiet for being so centrally located to both Atlantic Ave & Smith St, Brooklyn and to the subway for a 10 minute ride to lower Manhattan. Judy's communication before and throughout our stay was excellent and informative and she was also very accommodating with holding mail beforehand and a late checkout on our last day. The thoughtful provisioning was also welcomed for our late afternoon arrival meaning we didn't need to rush out and pick up essential supplies as soon as we settled in. Overall, a very easy and pleasant place to call home for an extended stay in New York.

We visited Judy's place with my boyfriend, to have a vacation in NY. My colleague recommended the place, and as it turned out, Judy is an excellent host. The apartment is a gem, the interior is hip & cool, and it's everything you need for a comfy stay in NY & in Brooklyn. 

The neighborhoods are full of nice restaurants and breakfast cafes, but the apartmen's kitchen is also fully equipped, and there is high-quality food markets nearby if you are interested to cook food by yourself. 

The metro is very close – it's super easy to navigate everywhere.  There's also nice boutiques and outlet stores to do some serious shopping, very nearby. During our stay was quite hot and humid weather, but the air conditioning worked perfectly. The apartment was a perfect place to rest after a full day of exploring the city.

Judy was super helpful with all of our questions with restaurant recommendations & helped to manage with our luggage during the check out. It was a perfect, relaxed get-away week in NY, so if you notice this apartment is available during your stay, we can warmly recommend it!

Estuvimos alojados 10 días en la casa de Judy. El apartamento está puesto con muy buen gusto y cumplió con todas nuestras expectativas. El barrio es lindo y perfectamente comunicado. Tiene cerca zonas comerciales y pequeños restaurantes para todos los gustos.
Nos alojamos con mi marido y mi hija ocupó el cuarto separado al que se accede desde la escalera, esto fue una gran cosa y le permitió tener cierta independencia. Judy se preocupó todo el tiempo por hacernos sentir cómodos, hasta nos dejó insumos para prepararnos el primer desayuno sabiendo que llegaríamos a la noche. Recomendaría este alojamiento sin ninguna duda.

This place is my favorite NYC airbnb by far, lovely hosts live above a spacious, impeccably clean and well equipped apartment that's perfectly located close to everything in Brooklyn. I appreciated the new locks on the doors which didn't cause me sticky key troubles, the double pane windows in the bedroom made it quiet and serene for sleeping. Well equipped kitchen and comfortable bed too. Thank you Judy!!!

Judy was available when we arrived but had also advised us how to get access if she had not beeen at home. The apartment was all we expected and proved a great base for our exploration of New York with great subway access close by. The local area also provided great experiences as well guided by Judy's local recommendations. Having the host so accessible and approachable also provided convenient problem solving potential when needed (printing event tickets) but overall very happy with our first international Airbnb experience. 
Dennis & Mariann Fee
Judy' place was great. Exactly as advertised. Very professionally run.
Great location in Boerum Hill near shops, restaurants and subway stations. Beautiful apartment. Judy was very responsive during our stay. I'd definitely stay here again!
A very homely place in Brooklyn.

Fantastic location – close to all the subway lines. A short walk to great shops and restaurants. Loved the space – it was clean, spacious, with the amenities I needed. Easy check in. Thanks Judy for a great stay.

Judy was a fantastic host. Everything we needed was provided and after a long flight she was on hand to recommend the nearest restaurant. Brilliant!
Beautiful apartment, tastefully furnished, spotlessly clean and bright and sunny.
A hidden gem.
Great location, stylish & cozy apartment and fantastic hosts. We will return.

The location is very well situated and peaceful. The apartment is very clean and comfortable. It is also equipped with almost everything you should need for your stay including washing and drying machine. There is a variety of restaurants and eateries to satisfy most pallets in the surrounding areas. In case of emergencies, there is a convenient small bodega that is open 24/7 just across the street. Thank you for the bottle of wine that was left. We would definitely recommend this apartment.
